story:
Your gracious contributions will help us complete in-school testing in 2019 and push us closer to helping kids overcome attention challenges and realize their true potential.

If you are impacted by a youngster who struggles to pay attention, is demotivated and lacks confidence please support our campaign so we can bring our product to market.

Testing takes money and we can't do it alone. Please contribute.

Also check out our meaningful and fun perks!

Students deserve a ConfiBoost.

-----

Please read on to get all the information you need to know your investment will make a difference. Thanks!

 

Introducing ConfiBoost: Smart Eyewear that is designed to help students naturally strengthen attention and focus skills that are sustained after training. 

When the user loses focus, the lenses will occlude. The safe sensor rests on the forehead and monitors brain signal activity, looking for indicators of declining focus. When loss of concentration is detected the lenses darken for 2 seconds, this visual reminder nudges the student to pay attention while reading  and can have long-lasting results after a period of sustained training. 

 
The ConfiBoost  neurocognitive training system is an affordable, safe, long-lasting, and effective solution to address attention deficits, learning challenges and reading gaps in US schools. Safe and effective neurocognitive training can  improve attentiveness over time and those gains can be sustained. See peer-reviewed research studies below. These kids deserve a boost!
 

"The last 4 years I've been on a mission to bring science, the scientific method and creativity and critical reasoning to the epidemic of attention-challenges that affect our schools. We have been successful in putting together a world-class team of teachers, neuroscientists, neurofeedback practitioners, engineers and marketers to construct an innovative patented solution we think will make a difference in the lives of many young people and equip them for fulfilling lives."

                                                      -Rod Greder, Founder & CEO of Awear Technologies

Please watch the following video to hear about what drove us to develop ConfiBoost eyewear to help kids struggling with attention challenges.

 

Students with ADHD and other attention challenges often fall behind in the classroom. We've designed ConfiBoost to change that by targeting the source of attention issues. Other interventions, like psychostimulants, lessen the symptoms for a period of time. Our smart eyewear helps retrain the brain by reminding students when their mind wanders and helps them be more self-aware that they need to refocus.

This self awareness helps strengthen their attention skills and this self control can be maintained.

Without attention there is no learning. No encoding, storage or retrieval. It is as simple as that!

 

Is there science and data behind the product?

Peer-reviewed studies have shown that neurocognitive training done in schools is effective and the results are maintained at least six months. [Steiner, N. J., Frenette, E. C., Rene K. M., Brennan, R. T., & Perrin, E. C. (2014). In-school neurofeedback training for ADHD: Sustained improvements from a randomized control trial. Pediatrics, 133(3), 483-492. doi: 10.1542/peds.2013-2059. https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/24534402]

American Academy of Pediatrics (AAP) and American Academy of Child and Adolescent Psychiatry (AACAP) have provided strong support for the use of EEG-biofeedback to improve attention.  http://www.braintrainuk.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/07/How-AAP-reached-conclusion-other-recent-evidence-July-2013-V3.pdf 

NASA and the US military have been involved in the development and testing of EEG biofeedback. DARPA (Defense Advanced Research Project Agency) has tested the use of neurofeedback to improve marksmanship.  https://www.cwilsonmeloncelli.com/490-improveme... NASA has worked with startups to commercialize neurofeedback. https://spinoff.nasa.gov/Spinoff2013/cg_2.html

                                    

We have data with a small sample of college students. We tested the prototype with eight average to above average students in 2017. We saw changes in reading scores with limited sessions. We need to repeat these trials with more subjects over a longer period of time to confirm results (especially with those struggling to pay attention). We also must begin testing of pre-adolescents which is where we think we can make the greatest impact in improving attention that leads to better learning outcomes like reading.

 

We measured brain signals that have been determined to relate to alertness, attention and focus. We've chosen key brain locations to monitor and we continue to analyze new signal patterns, locations and new hardware to maximize our accuracy in providing feedback. 

   

 

We  also asked the user to reflect and integrate during the darkening of the lenses. This reflection period has appeared to provide improvements in comprehension scores specifically when reading more difficult material. We are following up on this interesting finding.

 

How big is the need for this product?

Roughly 10 million students in elementary schools today could benefit from a cognitive training intervention to improve attention. Watch the following video to hear the stories of students, parents and teachers:

 

Cognitive training helps individuals develop better control over thoughts, actions, and behaviors, including self-control. Parents tend to look toward medication to alleviate ADHD symptoms, but this is not effective for 20-30% of users. When medication does work, it often comes with considerable side effects: nervousness, restlessness, insomnia, headaches, and more. Medications have no lasting results when you stop taking them. EEG-neurofeedback training builds the long-term skills that make it easier to pay attention in the future. 

Unlike brain training games, the eyewear helps the user develop skills during primary activities-- reading, listening, and studying. ConfiBoost targets the source of attention problems rather than just treating symptoms. Brain training games where you need to pay attention to changes on a screen have a major flaw— they don't readily translate to improved skills or learning capabilities. Although you get better at paying attention to the game, the brain pathways that control attention during reading, studying or listening to a teacher are little changed. Students benefit more from training themselves in real-life situations.

 

How does it work?

It only takes one touch of a hot stove for you to learn not to do it. Feedback works!

 

While getting burned is a bit extreme, the feedback needs to be disruptive enough so that you notice and are motivated to change behaviors. ConfiBoost is an EEG device, meaning that it can detect brain electrical activity and follow brain signal patterns. When you lose focus, the lenses will darken, signaling the wearer to focus their attention. 

 

Behavioral science and learning theory show that learning is proportional to stimulus. When a person is too relaxed or too stressed, less learning occurs. ConfiBoost helps students stay at the right level of focus to learn in real-life situations.

See the graphic below to understand how the feedback works to get the student's attention, how they personally perceive it and react to it, how their brain is changing as they train and the learning outcomes that are expected.

 

The student will use the eyewear while reading for 10-20 minute sessions several times per week over 6-8 weeks. They are evaluated with comprehension/recall tests after each session. Standardized attention tests are also conducted.

Our wearable allows the student to work on strengthening attentional pathways while doing the task they want to improve. Neuropathways are most flexible in younger years, so school-aged kids can benefit the most from ConfiBoost. Staying focused actually becomes easier over time because students gradually build their attention skills and confidence.

 

Watch video to see real-time operation of the dashboard. Re-watch end of student and parents video above to see operation of glasses paired with the dashboard.

 
Glasses occluding when mind-wandering (above the threshold) and glasses clearing when focusing (below the threshold). The glasses are clear enough to not obstruct reading even though still tinted.
 
 

 

There are other EEG devices in the market, but ConfiBoost  is the only one that gives the wearer disruptive, visual feedback that literally and figuratively gets their attention. 

 

Has the technology been reviewed and supported?

Awear Technologies has received grants from several government funding agencies in the past: NIH (National Institute of Health), NSF (National Science Foundation) and the Department of Education. This funding has gone towards ConfiBoost prototype development and early pilot studies.

              

 

Has the product gained awareness and been recognized?

Awear has received awards for its product! We were honored as a Visionary Finalist in the Intel Make it Wearable Challenge in 2014. Awear was also an award recipient in Minnesota’s Tekne Awards, a finalist in the Minnesota Cup, a finalist in the Software and Information Industry Association Innovator Competition and won the ACT award at the 2017 Milken-Penn Graduate School of Education EdTech competition. The founder, Dr. Greder, has also been awarded an Initiator Fellowship from the Initiative Foundation.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     

 

We have been featured in numerous publications, including the  Minneapolis Star Tribune, St Paul Pioneer Press, IQ Magazine, TECH dot MN, and Twin Cities Business. 

                              

 

What's next?

In order to help students catch up and get ahead, we need your help. We have been developing the product for the past several years, but need your support in order to develop and produce our final design and conduct in-school testing.

Our campaign goal is $50k, and any amount helps!

Even if you are unable to donate, please click 'Share' and spread the word about ConfiBoost!

We aren't yet selling our product, but are making strides towards our first production run, planned for next year.

We want to launch ConfiBoost in 2019/20, but need additional funding to stay on schedule.

 

How will the money be invested?

We will use the investment to:

  • conduct in-school trials at two charter schools in Minnesota in 2019. (50%)
  • continue development of our software interface. (20%)
  • continue usability testing to ensure comfort, fit and effectiveness. (20%)
  • begin planning for scale up and production. (10%)

Our stretch goal of $150k will let us validate our hardware and software and begin final design work for the production model and to do more in-school testing.

We are committed to having solid verifiable evidence that we can make a difference in kid's lives!           

    

 

We appreciate your support! Thank you for your commitment to improving student learning in a safe and effective way.   

                                    

Who's on the team?

Our team has a long record of success in product development, marketing and commercialization. We've also partnered with many universities and other organizations 

 

Rod Greder, Ph.D – Founder/CEO - In addition to a 25 year career in product development and marketing, Rod is a teacher who is passionate about helping kids excel in school.  His industry experience includes new product discovery, development and deployment, technology licensing and executive management with life science businesses. It is his 15 years of teaching experience that led Dr. Greder to start Awear Technologies with the goal of helping students improve their cognitive skill gaps to improve classroom behaviors and accelerate learning outcomes.

Steve Mesmer, COO, Steve has over 20 years of direct experience designing, developing, and deploying effective educational technology applications including integrated learning systems, assessment systems, and data and reporting applications for application in K-12 classrooms. With a rigorous background in pedagogy, user-centered design, pilot testing, product research, and learning theory, Mr. Mesmer has served in a variety of executive positions with large-scale education publishers and was responsible for numerous successful product deployments.

Gary Jader, MBA – VP, Marketing & Business Development - Gary Jader is an experienced product tinkerer and clinician who is passionate about making a difference in the lives of young people. Extensive career in healthcare.Taught for the past decade, been a board member of one of top performing high schools in MN. Gary has experienced firsthand the struggles of poor attentiveness with his two sons being diagnosed with ADHD. Gary shares his story in our video.

George Martin, Licensed Psychologist, has used neurofeedback in his clinic since 1997. He has a strong commitment to developing and providing high quality mental health services for adults, children and families.  He has consulted with many organizations on EEG hardware and software projects and be involved in test design and analysis.

Art Felgate, Engineer AWEAR is an inventor and electronic product developer with 25 years of experience in industries including biomedical, Internet-of-Things, intelligent transportation, remote monitoring, data storage, fiber optic communications, and consumer. He has held professional roles as an engineer, product manager, and sales engineer. In addition, Art has been a founding or early member of startup companies based upon products he has developed. 

We've also been fortunate to have many interns from the University of Minnesota and Minnesota State that have contributed greatly.

 

Risk or Challenges?

We could run into hardware or software challenges but we are utilizing proven technology and deploying a standard format for software development. Our team has experience in these areas and has access to world-class expertise. We are using best practices to complete hardware and software testing.

We also have a strong patent to protect our product and will use it to ensure our ability to compete.

           

 

Questions or Concerns?

Feel free to reach out to our team via Indiegogo, our website or direct email: 

Awear Technologies Website: www.AwearTechnologies.net/contact
Awear Technologies Email: rod@aweartechnologies.net

If you know others that would be willing to support our campaign to help kids improve learning outcomes, please help spread the word via our social media connections:

Awear Technologies at Facebook: facebook.com/aweartech
Awear Technologies at Twitter: twitter.com/AwearTech
Awear Technologies at YouTube: www.youtube.com/channel/UCAeFJL9G-uWBoGDz9ww4heQ
Awear Technologies at LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/rodgreder

Thank you!

When loss of concentration is detected the lenses darken for 2 seconds, this visual reminder nudges the student to pay attention while reading  and can have long-lasting results after a period of sustained training.  The ConfiBoost  neurocognitive training system is an affordable, safe, long-lasting, and effective solution to address attention deficits, learning challenges and reading gaps in US schools. Safe and effective neurocognitive training can  improve attentiveness over time and those gains can be sustained. See peer-reviewed research studies below. These kids deserve a boost!

 "The last 4 years I've been on a mission to bring science, the scientific method and creativity and critical reasoning to the epidemic of attention-challenges that affect our schools. We have been successful in putting together a world-class team of teachers, neuroscientists, neurofeedback practitioners, engineers and marketers to construct an innovative patented solution we think will make a difference in the lives of many young people and equip them for fulfilling lives."                                                      -Rod Greder, Founder & CEO of Awear TechnologiesPlease watch the following video to hear about what drove us to develop ConfiBoost eyewear to help kids struggling with attention challenges.

 
Students with ADHD and other attention challenges often fall behind in the classroom. We've designed ConfiBoost to change that by targeting the source of attention issues. Other interventions, like psychostimulants, lessen the symptoms for a period of time. Our smart eyewear helps retrain the brain by reminding students when their mind wanders and helps them be more self-aware that they need to refocus.
This self awareness helps strengthen their attention skills and this self control can be maintained.Without attention there is no learning. No encoding, storage or retrieval. It is as simple as that! Is there science and data behind the product?Peer-reviewed studies have shown that neurocognitive training done in schools is effective and the results are maintained at least six months. [Steiner, N. J., Frenette, E. C., Rene K. M., Brennan, R. T., & Perrin, E. C. (2014). In-school neurofeedback training for ADHD: Sustained improvements from a randomized control trial. Pediatrics, 133(3), 483-492. doi: 10.1542/peds.2013-2059. https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/24534402]American Academy of Pediatrics (AAP) and American Academy of Child and Adolescent Psychiatry (AACAP) have provided strong support for the use of EEG-biofeedback to improve attention.  http://www.braintrainuk.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/07/How-AAP-reached-conclusion-other-recent-evidence-July-2013-V3.pdf NASA and the US military have been involved in the development and testing of EEG biofeedback. DARPA (Defense Advanced Research Project Agency) has tested the use of neurofeedback to improve marksmanship.  https://www.cwilsonmeloncelli.com/490-improveme... NASA has worked with startups to commercialize neurofeedback. https://spinoff.nasa.gov/Spinoff2013/cg_2.html                                    We have data with a small sample of college students. We tested the prototype with eight average to above average students in 2017. We saw changes in reading scores with limited sessions. We need to repeat these trials with more subjects over a longer period of time to confirm results (especially with those struggling to pay attention). We also must begin testing of pre-adolescents which is where we think we can make the greatest impact in improving attention that leads to better learning outcomes like reading. We measured brain signals that have been determined to relate to alertness, attention and focus. We've chosen key brain locations to monitor and we continue to analyze new signal patterns, locations and new hardware to maximize our accuracy in providing feedback.     We  also asked the user to reflect and integrate during the darkening of the lenses. This reflection period has appeared to provide improvements in comprehension scores specifically when reading more difficult material. We are following up on this interesting finding. How big is the need for this product?Roughly 10 million students in elementary schools today could benefit from a cognitive training intervention to improve attention. Watch the following video to hear the stories of students, parents and teachers: Cognitive training helps individuals develop better control over thoughts, actions, and behaviors, including self-control. Parents tend to look toward medication to alleviate ADHD symptoms, but this is not effective for 20-30% of users. When medication does work, it often comes with considerable side effects: nervousness, restlessness, insomnia, headaches, and more. Medications have no lasting results when you stop taking them. EEG-neurofeedback training builds the long-term skills that make it easier to pay attention in the future. Unlike brain training games, the eyewear helps the user develop skills during primary activities-- reading, listening, and studying. ConfiBoost targets the source of attention problems rather than just treating symptoms. Brain training games where you need to pay attention to changes on a screen have a major flaw— they don't readily translate to improved skills or learning capabilities. Although you get better at paying attention to the game, the brain pathways that control attention during reading, studying or listening to a teacher are little changed. Students benefit more from training themselves in real-life situations. How does it work?It only takes one touch of a hot stove for you to learn not to do it. Feedback works! While getting burned is a bit extreme, the feedback needs to be disruptive enough so that you notice and are motivated to change behaviors. ConfiBoost is an EEG device, meaning that it can detect brain electrical activity and follow brain signal patterns. When you lose focus, the lenses will darken, signaling the wearer to focus their attention.  Behavioral science and learning theory show that learning is proportional to stimulus. When a person is too relaxed or too stressed, less learning occurs. ConfiBoost helps students stay at the right level of focus to learn in real-life situations.See the graphic below to understand how the feedback works to get the student's attention, how they personally perceive it and react to it, how their brain is changing as they train and the learning outcomes that are expected. The student will use the eyewear while reading for 10-20 minute sessions several times per week over 6-8 weeks. They are evaluated with comprehension/recall tests after each session. Standardized attention tests are also conducted.Our wearable allows the student to work on strengthening attentional pathways while doing the task they want to improve. Neuropathways are most flexible in younger years, so school-aged kids can benefit the most from ConfiBoost. Staying focused actually becomes easier over time because students gradually build their attention skills and confidence. Watch video to see real-time operation of the dashboard. Re-watch end of student and parents video above to see operation of glasses paired with the dashboard. Glasses occluding when mind-wandering (above the threshold) and glasses clearing when focusing (below the threshold). The glasses are clear enough to not obstruct reading even though still tinted.

 

  There are other EEG devices in the market, but ConfiBoost  is the only one that gives the wearer disruptive, visual feedback that literally and figuratively gets their attention.  Has the technology been reviewed and supported?Awear Technologies has received grants from several government funding agencies in the past: NIH (National Institute of Health), NSF (National Science Foundation) and the Department of Education. This funding has gone towards ConfiBoost prototype development and early pilot studies.               Has the product gained awareness and been recognized?Awear has received awards for its product! We were honored as a Visionary Finalist in the Intel Make it Wearable Challenge in 2014. Awear was also an award recipient in Minnesota’s Tekne Awards, a finalist in the Minnesota Cup, a finalist in the Software and Information Industry Association Innovator Competition and won the ACT award at the 2017 Milken-Penn Graduate School of Education EdTech competition. The founder, Dr. Greder, has also been awarded an Initiator Fellowship from the Initiative Foundation.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      We have been featured in numerous publications, including the  Minneapolis Star Tribune, St Paul Pioneer Press, IQ Magazine, TECH dot MN, and Twin Cities Business.                                What's next?In order to help students catch up and get ahead, we need your help. We have been developing the product for the past several years, but need your support in order to develop and produce our final design and conduct in-school testing.Our campaign goal is $50k, and any amount helps!Even if you are unable to donate, please click 'Share' and spread the word about ConfiBoost!We aren't yet selling our product, but are making strides towards our first production run, planned for next year.We want to launch ConfiBoost in 2019/20, but need additional funding to stay on schedule. How will the money be invested?We will use the investment to:
conduct in-school trials at two charter schools in Minnesota in 2019. (50%)
continue development of our software interface. (20%)
continue usability testing to ensure comfort, fit and effectiveness. (20%)
begin planning for scale up and production. (10%)
Our stretch goal of $150k will let us validate our hardware and software and begin final design work for the production model and to do more in-school testing.We are committed to having solid verifiable evidence that we can make a difference in kid's lives!                We appreciate your support! Thank you for your commitment to improving student learning in a safe and effective way.                                       Who's on the team?Our team has a long record of success in product development, marketing and commercialization. We've also partnered with many universities and other organizations  Rod Greder, Ph.D – Founder/CEO - In addition to a 25 year career in product development and marketing, Rod is a teacher who is passionate about helping kids excel in school.  His industry experience includes new product discovery, development and deployment, technology licensing and executive management with life science businesses. It is his 15 years of teaching experience that led Dr. Greder to start Awear Technologies with the goal of helping students improve their cognitive skill gaps to improve classroom behaviors and accelerate learning outcomes.Steve Mesmer, COO, Steve has over 20 years of direct experience designing, developing, and deploying effective educational technology applications including integrated learning systems, assessment systems, and data and reporting applications for application in K-12 classrooms. With a rigorous background in pedagogy, user-centered design, pilot testing, product research, and learning theory, Mr. Mesmer has served in a variety of executive positions with large-scale education publishers and was responsible for numerous successful product deployments.Gary Jader, MBA – VP, Marketing & Business Development - Gary Jader is an experienced product tinkerer and clinician who is passionate about making a difference in the lives of young people. Extensive career in healthcare.Taught for the past decade, been a board member of one of top performing high schools in MN. Gary has experienced firsthand the struggles of poor attentiveness with his two sons being diagnosed with ADHD. Gary shares his story in our video.George Martin, Licensed Psychologist, has used neurofeedback in his clinic since 1997. He has a strong commitment to developing and providing high quality mental health services for adults, children and families.  He has consulted with many organizations on EEG hardware and software projects and be involved in test design and analysis.Art Felgate, Engineer AWEAR is an inventor and electronic product developer with 25 years of experience in industries including biomedical, Internet-of-Things, intelligent transportation, remote monitoring, data storage, fiber optic communications, and consumer. He has held professional roles as an engineer, product manager, and sales engineer. In addition, Art has been a founding or early member of startup companies based upon products he has developed. We've also been fortunate to have many interns from the University of Minnesota and Minnesota State that have contributed greatly. Risk or Challenges?We could run into hardware or software challenges but we are utilizing proven technology and deploying a standard format for software development. Our team has experience in these areas and has access to world-class expertise. We are using best practices to complete hardware and software testing.We also have a strong patent to protect our product and will use it to ensure our ability to compete.            Questions or Concerns?Feel free to reach out to our team via Indiegogo, our website or direct email: Awear Technologies Website: www.AwearTechnologies.net/contactAwear Technologies Email: rod@aweartechnologies.netIf you know others that would be willing to support our campaign to help kids improve learning outcomes, please help spread the word via our social media connections:Awear Technologies at Facebook: facebook.com/aweartechAwear Technologies at Twitter: twitter.com/AwearTechAwear Technologies at YouTube: www.youtube.com/channel/UCAeFJL9G-uWBoGDz9ww4heQAwear Technologies at LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/rodgrederThank you!

story:
Evolve Creative Alliance is a nonprofit organization specializing in social-emotional and community development through the creation of sensory, holistic learning experiences for children and their families. With the help of our supporters, we have been able to conceptualize a traveling classroom and workshop space, work with a Sustainable Interior Designer to transfer our vision into a blueprint, and purchase a previously owned & gutted, 2005 IC School Bus all within the last year!

We are ready to begin the 1st phase of build-out for our Traveling Peace Studio- a sustainable traveling classroom and studio equipped with compost and running water capabilities. Our bus will also run on bio-diesel fuel. This project emphasizes the transformative power of mindfully designed educational spaces. It will be used for workshops which develop positive coping mechanisms, compassionate communication, nutrition, constructive hobbies, a knowledge of world history, & a respectful relationship with nature.

This space will support equity through providing services through an affordable “pop up” dynamic and by hiring diverse teaching artists. Our workshops collaborate with community members from the planning and processing stage and beyond.

With your support via donations and sponsorships we can complete renovations by Fall to be able to travel to a few cities- New York, Newark, & Philly before the end of the year.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Cecilia and I am a Kindergarten Teacher in California! I am a first generation college student. I come from an immigrant background myself and as an educator I hope to enhance the learning experience for students K-5 in the United States by teaching them about the lives of students who also come from immigrant backgrounds.

I am asking for an initial $5,000 in order to fund the development of two entire books from start to finish. Every additional $2,000 or so will fund another book.

This project is extremely important in our society because we need to be able to represent the millions of immigrant families in the US and worldwide. This book will be a stepping stone in redefining the way in which K-5 teachers educate their students.

The potential risks of this project is limited support, however, I plan to overcome this by connecting with my educator community and beyond. I am tenacious and passionate about this, therefore I do not plan on letting it go.

If you are unable to contribute, please share on your social media platforms! Please help me make a difference for the leaders of our future by investing in the stepping stone to educating students about different cultures worldwide.

story:
About Flawless Designs, LLC

Flawless Designs, LLC is a social enterprise founded by three sisters, Kayla Dowdy, Kiana Oliver and Shanice Oliver with the mission to promote diversified  and inclusive educational enrichment experiences through art and technology.  As a company founded by women, we are passionate about protecting and nourishing the minds of young ladies of color through engaging activities that reflect relevant culture, inspiration and dialogue. Our values of loyalty, growth, creativity and education allows us to be true to ourselves as leaders and focus on the mission at hand.

We will engage students by creating a culturally relevant collection of audio and wood books to enhance developmental learning.

We will engage students with culturally relevant activity books, puzzles and challenges to steward interactive learning and digital techniques.

We will inspire positivity and critical thinking through messaging and literature.

Your Contribution Matters

According to research and studies from the University of Memphis School of Social Work, Memphis has a child poverty rate of 44.9% (18 and younger) as of 2019. Non-hispanic black families make up 38% of the total poverty gap in Memphis.  In addition, Memphis, TN is ranked 2nd with the highest poverty rate. Flawless Designs will cater to a diversity of students from all walks of life, our city will develop it's local talent and demand for highly skilled job oppotunitites.

At Flawless Designs LLC, we believe representation and education creates a pipeline for success. With your seed into the Seed Sowers Club, you are helping students to see themselves succeed while engaging in tangible educational learning experiences. 

  • Your seed will help finalize the publication of the Demi's Adventure Book Collection via audio and wood books.
  • Your seed will create the pipeline for students who are often left behind.
  • Your seed will allow our team to continue spreading encouraging and relevent content to inspire continuous learning for students.

As contributors of our social enterprise, we will offer Flawless Designs Merch, recognition on our website and our first book collection, as well as a social media shoutout. 

Measure of Impact

As we put our best foot forward to help our community, we value seeing young children change for greatness. Flawless Designs will measure the following:

  • Survey teachers from partnering schools targeting 38126, 38105, 38108, 38127 and 38106.
  • Capture engagement of programs and activity participation from students.
  • Monitor follows on social media to capture students interest in content.

Risks & Challenges

While we are striving for excellence for our young people, there is always a reality of risk. Flawless Designs, LLC will not hold back our creativity because of how much we value our students. We want to share some possible challenges we could face but will not limit us from being succcessful:

  • Relationship building with schools maybe difficult due to virtual learning environment
  • Ensuring students we desire to help have adequate devices to interact with us  

Other Ways You Can Help

You're help means so much to us because we truly cannot make a difference without your help. While we are striving to raise $2,000 to launch our company, connections and advisory is helpful also! If you are interested in connnecting or have a resource referral, contact Shanice Oliver.

story:
A quarterly activity and school supply subscription box designed to engage kids in learning and empower parents to teach their children skills for future success. 

Boxes are for busy families looking for valuable content to help develop their children beyond formal school curriculum. 

       

 

  

PARENTS WERE LOOKING FOR VALUABLE LEARNING ACTIVITIES DURING COVID-19

Originally created to assist parents as a result of the Covid-19 outbreak.  We realized parents were overwhelmed and needed a solution to help engage in valuable learning activities with their children, and looking for ways to save on supplies for school in this unknown environment.

YOUR CHILD'S FAVORITE TEACHER IS YOU!!!

Children whose parents are active in their learning are more confident, have better grades, develop social skills, and are motivated to learn.  For this reason, fun family learning activities are core to our boxes to help empower parents to teach their children. 

 

ACTIVITIES BEYOND CRAFTS & FORMAL SCHOOL CURRICULUM

Activities included inot only help with Parent-Child engagement, but they provide skills that can be used for future success. 

 

When it comes to preparing your kids for the future, it is imperative they understand Money, Technology, Who They Are, and Basic Life Skills.

Designed for Elementary-aged students (school, home schooled, or remote learning), but can make a great gift to any student, teacher, principal, tutor, or guidance counselor.             

     

    

Created by parents for parents to empower the inner teacher inside us. 

Jeff and Thai want to help EMPOWER parents in teaching their children skills that will build their confidence and skillset for long term success. 

 

 

In the boxes, they include family fun activities that allow parents to teach their children about financial literacy, identity/heritage, life skills, and technology. 

Is a comprehensive solution for parents to teach conveniently and in a fun way. 

 

 

 

Risk & Challenges:

The most significant challenges to this project are:

1: Unknown landscape for elementary students due to COVID-19

2: Project Kickoff Timing

story:
BACKGROUND

Founder, Derrick O'Neal is a father, grandfather, former basketball coach, and a life-long learner. He faced numerous challenges as a young man struggling with dyslexia because he didn’t have the resources to help him understand his unique learning difference. Through Derrick's experience of raising three sons, coaching basketball teams and spending thousands of hours trying to find the right educational resources for them, he developed a system of recommendations that helped his sons and his players to better understand their strengths and weaknesses in order to build and hone their skills. This gave them a deeper understanding of themselves which empowered them to learn, grow, and succeed. This successful experience set the tone for creating NuuEDScore™.


WHAT is NuuEDScore™ and WHY NuuEDScore™?

NuuEDScore™ is a service purposefully built to understand learners' unique learning personality, skill levels and aptitudes to deliver tailored recommendations and content
in the areas of skill development, job readiness and educational opportunities.

NuuEDScore™ is set to be the next big artificial intelligence smart matching platform
on the planet. 

 

 

HOW DOES NuuEDScore™ WORK?

 
It's simple! NuuEDScore™ uses a three step process to evaluate an individual.
The first step is a personality assessment and learning style assessment which
determines learner's personality type, thus allowing the platform to determine
what kind of courses and skill improvements are the right fit for the learner.

The second step is an education, financial, career readiness, and interview assessment
that identifies your skills in these specific areas.

During the third step, we use cluster analytics, cognitive analytics, correlative analytics and artificial intelligence to determine your scores and match customized content and related opportunities (jobs, schools, tutors, grants, etc.) based on those scores.

Knowing how to improve and grow your learner towards the best possible economic
outcomes is a game-changing attribute of NuuEDScore™. The content recommendation
engine is powered with our proprietary machine-learning algorithm.
 

 

HOW CAN YOU HELP?

We need $40,000 to finalize the production of our service and to begin expanding it into other skills, empowering it with further capabilities to benefit your loved ones. As one of the early backers, you will be able to contribute at 5 different levels, each granting you a different level of opportunity to experience NuuEDScore™, as well as share it with your learners as well as your community.

Supporting NuuEDScore™ is an investment into a sound future, in which young learners nationwide will gain access to a powerful machine learning platform, first of its kind, at an affordable cost. This thorough impact on education will leave lasting changes on the future generations, creating an economic impact of profound magnitude.

 

HOW WILL NuuEDScore™ USE THE DONATIONS

Once we reach our goal we will immediately start development of the NuuEDScore™ platform. 
 

* Build a fully functional prototype that will be handed off to the development team and the             engineering team.

* Build our recommendations search engine with robust, education and job resource digital             libraries.
         Connect to 100 content digital libraries 
         Connect to scientific digital assessment libraries
         Connect to multi state standard testing Digital libraries

* Curate custom tailored information from multiple state standard resources (content specific
    to each user will have a user fee to access the libraries)

* Build users performance dashboard
* Build administrative educational performance dashboard
* Build employer (career recruitment) dashboard

 

THE IMPACT

NuuEDScore™ will be able to create a reliable skill matching system that will enable skill-centric economic mobility, which will allow people of all backgrounds to make a breakthrough in financial achievements while focusing on their areas of strength. Proven to raise reading levels
by 70%.
 

 .      




 

NUUED SOLUTIONS

NuuEDScore™ is the future of learning and with education becoming more challenging, methods of learning should be able to adapt to an individual's educational needs.
NuuEDScore™ relates to the current state and the future of learning displayed in
these videos:
 

   
 

 . 
   
 
 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Just because you can't contribute, doesn't mean you can't help. Please share our story with your social media followers on Facebook, LinkedIn, and Twitter. Please use Indiegogo share tools and help us spread the word on our education-focused project.

Getting involved with NuuEDScore™ matters. Being a part of this educational evolution means staying close to a grassroots movement that not only emphasizes technology, but has a focus on helping the community as well.

 

MEET OUR TEAM


 

 

 

 

 




 

NuuEDScore™  IS FOR U ABOUT U: Learn About Yourself to Improve Yourself.

It's Derrick, the Founder of NuuED Inc. here, and I'm writing to you today to share a deeply personal experience – and how it's affected my whole life.

Growing up, I was often on the bad end of bullying, other kids calling me dumb because of my dyslexia. We now recognize that there are students who have dyslexia who can learn just as any other students, growing up to become doctors, entrepreneurs, and thought leaders. At the time, though, for me, it seemed like there was no light at the end of the tunnel.

My team and I have created NuuEDScore™ for the young people who feel as I did as a child.  We want to help them see their options. The service platform is a cutting-edge tool that students and job seekers can use to make better decisions regarding their careers and their education. NuuEDScore™ helps learners improve their reading levels and other test scores. The innovative system was put through a rigorous test study with an elementary school in Vallejo, Ca. The results showed that the students overall reading scores skyrocketed by 70% in just two weeks.

No one should ever feel hopeless because of a disability or learning style, and NuuEDScore™ is tool that could make an individual’s learning and career development experience more effective.

The NuuEDScore™ crowdfunding campaign is on Indiegogo, and for a limited time only, we are offering lifetime subscriptions to the platform. Please make a donation, and be sure to share the link with all your friends and family on social media. Together, we can change the world.

 

Thank you,
Derrick O'Neal, Founder
story_txt:
BACKGROUNDFounder, Derrick O'Neal is a father, grandfather, former basketball coach, and a life-long learner. He faced numerous challenges as a young man struggling with dyslexia because he didn’t have the resources to help him understand his unique learning difference. Through Derrick's experience of raising three sons, coaching basketball teams and spending thousands of hours trying to find the right educational resources for them, he developed a system of recommendations that helped his sons and his players to better understand their strengths and weaknesses in order to build and hone their skills. This gave them a deeper understanding of themselves which empowered them to learn, grow, and succeed. This successful experience set the tone for creating NuuEDScore™.WHAT is NuuEDScore™ and WHY NuuEDScore™?NuuEDScore™ is a service purposefully built to understand learners' unique learning personality, skill levels and aptitudes to deliver tailored recommendations and contentin the areas of skill development, job readiness and educational opportunities.NuuEDScore™ is set to be the next big artificial intelligence smart matching platformon the planet. 
 



 
HOW DOES NuuEDScore™ WORK?
 It's simple! NuuEDScore™ uses a three step process to evaluate an individual.The first step is a personality assessment and learning style assessment whichdetermines learner's personality type, thus allowing the platform to determinewhat kind of courses and skill improvements are the right fit for the learner.The second step is an education, financial, career readiness, and interview assessmentthat identifies your skills in these specific areas.During the third step, we use cluster analytics, cognitive analytics, correlative analytics and artificial intelligence to determine your scores and match customized content and related opportunities (jobs, schools, tutors, grants, etc.) based on those scores.Knowing how to improve and grow your learner towards the best possible economicoutcomes is a game-changing attribute of NuuEDScore™. The content recommendationengine is powered with our proprietary machine-learning algorithm. 


 HOW CAN YOU HELP?We need $40,000 to finalize the production of our service and to begin expanding it into other skills, empowering it with further capabilities to benefit your loved ones. As one of the early backers, you will be able to contribute at 5 different levels, each granting you a different level of opportunity to experience NuuEDScore™, as well as share it with your learners as well as your community.Supporting NuuEDScore™ is an investment into a sound future, in which young learners nationwide will gain access to a powerful machine learning platform, first of its kind, at an affordable cost. This thorough impact on education will leave lasting changes on the future generations, creating an economic impact of profound magnitude. HOW WILL NuuEDScore™ USE THE DONATIONSOnce we reach our goal we will immediately start development of the NuuEDScore™ platform.   * Build a fully functional prototype that will be handed off to the development team and the             engineering team.* Build our recommendations search engine with robust, education and job resource digital             libraries.         Connect to 100 content digital libraries          Connect to scientific digital assessment libraries         Connect to multi state standard testing Digital libraries* Curate custom tailored information from multiple state standard resources (content specific    to each user will have a user fee to access the libraries)* Build users performance dashboard* Build administrative educational performance dashboard* Build employer (career recruitment) dashboard THE IMPACTNuuEDScore™ will be able to create a reliable skill matching system that will enable skill-centric economic mobility, which will allow people of all backgrounds to make a breakthrough in financial achievements while focusing on their areas of strength. Proven to raise reading levelsby 70%. 
 .      
 NUUED SOLUTIONSNuuEDScore™ is the future of learning and with education becoming more challenging, methods of learning should be able to adapt to an individual's educational needs.NuuEDScore™ relates to the current state and the future of learning displayed inthese videos:     
 .    

 
 
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELPJust because you can't contribute, doesn't mean you can't help. Please share our story with your social media followers on Facebook, LinkedIn, and Twitter. Please use Indiegogo share tools and help us spread the word on our education-focused project.Getting involved with NuuEDScore™ matters. Being a part of this educational evolution means staying close to a grassroots movement that not only emphasizes technology, but has a focus on helping the community as well. MEET OUR TEAM      NuuEDScore™  IS FOR U ABOUT U: Learn About Yourself to Improve Yourself.It's Derrick, the Founder of NuuED Inc. here, and I'm writing to you today to share a deeply personal experience – and how it's affected my whole life.Growing up, I was often on the bad end of bullying, other kids calling me dumb because of my dyslexia. We now recognize that there are students who have dyslexia who can learn just as any other students, growing up to become doctors, entrepreneurs, and thought leaders. At the time, though, for me, it seemed like there was no light at the end of the tunnel.My team and I have created NuuEDScore™ for the young people who feel as I did as a child.  We want to help them see their options. The service platform is a cutting-edge tool that students and job seekers can use to make better decisions regarding their careers and their education. NuuEDScore™ helps learners improve their reading levels and other test scores. The innovative system was put through a rigorous test study with an elementary school in Vallejo, Ca. The results showed that the students overall reading scores skyrocketed by 70% in just two weeks.No one should ever feel hopeless because of a disability or learning style, and NuuEDScore™ is tool that could make an individual’s learning and career development experience more effective.The NuuEDScore™ crowdfunding campaign is on Indiegogo, and for a limited time only, we are offering lifetime subscriptions to the platform. Please make a donation, and be sure to share the link with all your friends and family on social media. Together, we can change the world. Thank you,Derrick O'Neal, Founder

story:
Baatonum is the language of the Baatonu people of Northern Benin, but also of parts of Nigeria, Togo and Ivory Coast. It is the native language of close to 600'000 people.

Our project consists in the creation of the first free electronic dictionary in Baatonum that will be freely accessible to all. Our goal is to create 50'000 word forms, and to link them to all 100+ other languages that we have been developing so far in our System.

Electronic dictionaries are essential tools for:
  • Supporting the learning of languages in schools and for advanced studies in universities
  • Encouraging native speakers to use their language for sharing their cultural heritage
  • Promoting the usage and diffusion of languages in society and on the Internet
  • Helping the cultural and linguistic preservation of languages

By creating this unprecedented dictionary, the Baatonum language will be available among the many other so called "minority languages", for which we have already created similar resources, such as: Telugu, Punjabi, Sinhala (India); Bambara, Afrikaans, Berber (Africa); or Azerbaijani, Georgian and Armenian (Central Asia).

Why Baatonum?

Baatonum is a very peculiar tone language not closely related to any other language, and which has been claimed to present a challenge to several assumptions in Linguistics. 

Additionally, Baatonum is one of the hundreds of languages in the world for which there are very few resources available. As many other languages in developing Africa, it has been facing more and more the risk of being neglected and of being replaced by other major trade or ex-colonial languages. While this multilingual openness is an asset for many people, we also believe that native languages define every person's own culture, vision and way of thinking and, therefore, should be preserved. 

What is supposed to be done?

Our project aims at integrating 50'000 word forms from Baatonum into MUHIT, the MUltilingual Harmonized DicTionary, available at unlweb.net/muhit.

MUHIT is a free online harmonized dictionary where word forms from all languages are interlinked by sense indexes, which enable advanced multilingual and cross-cultural searches: synonyms, homonyms, language specific expressions, intercultural equivalences and varieties, etc. It is already one of the largest multilingual dictionaries in the world, containing more than 20 million entries, which have been created by our community. It is also the most diversified dictionary in the world, for it contains entries in 124 languages, among which many less-resourced languages, such as Romansh, Kabyle, Nahuatl, Shona and Wolof, for which, in some cases, we have created the first and largest free online dictionaries currently available.

How would you achieve this?

We have already a very complete framework for developing language resources. This is the UNLarium (available at www.unlweb.net), which was launched in 2010 and has been successfully used for the past five years to interlink languages from all over the world through a collaborative free open environment. 

The whole work is carried out by a community currently consisting of 2,000 language experts, who have been constantly expanding, evolving and improving our lexical databases. After pursuing the necessary certificates in our virtual learning environment, developers work in their mother tongue, from home, either as partners, as volunteers or as freelancers.

The whole work is supervised from the UNDL Foundation office in Geneva, which is responsible for setting the standards, controlling the quality of the work and integrating the entries in a huge network of language and knowledge.

What are the benefits of this initiative?

As a result of the current project, the following benefits are expected:

  • Baatonum will be linked to several other languages at the lexical level through MUHIT
  • Concepts that are specific to the Bariba culture will be identified, stored and preserved
  • The knowledge about Baatonum lexicography will be expanded
  • Local people in Benin will be trained in Computational Linguistics, one of today's most demanding scientific fields

And we ought to observe that all resources developed under this project will be released under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike License (i.e., for free), so that the whole community of researchers and users will be able to use them.

How the money will be used?

With 30'000 US$ we will cover the following expenses:

  • Finding and gathering a team of local language experts
  • Training the linguistic team in creating the dictionary entries
  • Remunerating the team for creating up to 50'000 word forms in Baatonum
  • Integrating these new words into MUHIT and, therefore, linking them to the other available languages

Any additional funds will be directly invested in the creation of more words of the Baatonum dictionary. 

Who are you?

The UNDL Foundation is a non-profit R&D organization, based in Geneva, Switzerland, entirely dedicated to create free multilingual resources with the aim of facilitating communication among all peoples and nations. Our main mission is to preserve cultural diversity and share knowledge by:

  • Creating resources for all languages, which are released for free
  • Treating minority and local languages at the same level as any major language
  • Sharing the knowledge embedded in all languages
  • Providing tools for each language to participate in a sustainable globalization


Additional Information / Contact:

www.undlfoundation.org
UNDL Foundation

48, route de Chancy
1213, Petit-Lancy, Geneva
Switzerland
e-mail: b.michels@undlfoundation.org
Tel.: +41 22 879 8094
Fax: +41 22 870 8091


Important information about your donation:

All donations will be sent to the King Baudouin Foundation in New York (www.kbfus.org), and then redistributed to the UNDL Foundation at the end of the campaign. The King Baudouin Foundation is a Belgian non-profit organization allowing non-US institutions to benefit from tax exempted donations from the US. The confirmation e-mail of your donation is thus being sent by the King Baudouin Foundation and not by the UNDL Foundation

story:
The Latest

Rowan Bailey, Midwife, remains under house arrest after her release from the Buncombe County Jail in December 2014.
Rowan's case has been indefinitely postponed due to a changing of the guards in the Buncombe County District Attorney's office. Rowan did get word last week from her attorney (public defender) that a new Assistant D.A. has been assigned to her case. This new ADA must familiarize himself with Rowan's case, which could take 6 months, maybe a year. Therefore, Families For Birth Freedom is reaching out to you for your support for Rowan.
Rowan's restrictions do NOT support her ability to work and provide for herself.  Due to the restrictions, she is only working approximately 18 hours per month. The state has restricted her work hours to 9am-1pm Monday, Wednesday, and Friday. Rowan is working as much as she can during that time. However, she is cleaning residential houses (the ONLY job the state will allow her to do at this time) and those hours do not often work for families.

We are asking for funds for Rowan for the following URGENTLY needed items:

  • Car Repairs & maintenance (to get to and from work)
  • Used Computer (to obtain work from home)
  • Dental Care (tooth pain, possible abscess)
  • Clothes for Court (her weight loss in jail has left her with no clothes that fit)

Who Is Families For Birth Freedom?

Our Philosophy

We believe that women have the inherent right to autonomy in their births. 

With this belief comes the right to autonomous practice for the providers who serve them.

Our Mission

Families for Birth Freedom was formed to provide a platform for birth professionals and the families they serve to connect with community and to access resources when facing criminal and/or civil prosecution as well as public persecution.

Our Philosophy

We are committed to raising awareness of legal and political situations that often arise when families choose who attends them, if anyone, during pregnancy, birth and beyond. We are equally committed to supporting and protecting birth professionals of all kinds who face similar legal and political struggles.  We will offer our support as facilitator, bringing your community together in action, fundraising, social/news media as well as emotional support and aftercare.


Case History:

Wednesday, March 27, 2013, a friend, teacher, mentor, and fellow midwife, Rowan Bailey, as she is known and loved was arrested for murder in Asheville, NC. North Carolina prohibits the practice of midwifery by traditional community midwives and CPM's. 

Pregnancy and birth are the most natural processes in the human experience.  This process has been supported, facilitated and protected since the dawn of time by the midwife.  Today, in the United States, over 98 percent of all births occur in a hospital setting; a medical facility.  Just under 2% of births occur out of the hospital, and approximately 1% of births occur at home with a midwife.  Are we really going to allow birth to be fully owned and operated by medical practitioners and surgeons? We inherently have rights to choose who, where, and how we birth. 

  • The United States ranks 34th in the world in infant mortality.  Babies die in the hospital all the time.  These numbers are unacceptable, yet persist despite the amount of dollars the U.S. spends on birth technology and interventions.

  • Midwives provide a choice in birth for families who want less medical intervention, and who want to preserve the spirit of birth. 

The way we birth is a HUMAN RIGHTS issue and we must embrace it with compassion, love, and responsibility. 

To learn more about Birth as a Human Rights Issue, please go towww.humanrightsinchildbirth.com

Midwife Needs Your Support Now!

  • Rowan Bailey, arrested for MURDER, remains on house arrest- almost 2 years after her initial arrest and incarceration.

  • The law under which she was arrested ishttp://www.ncga.state.nc.us/Sessions/2011/Bills/House/PDF/H215v1.pdf

  • Your funds will go directly to support Rowan to obtain necessary items and services.

 Get Involved

  • Please send this campaign out to your communities, your families, and your midwives.

  • Please send thoughts and prayers to all midwives who are in service to families around the world.

Thank You!

Families for Birth Freedom

www,familiesforbirthfreedom.org

https://www.facebook.com/familiesforbirthfreedom

story:
Do kids really play Nordic folk music? Yes, they do!

The Seattle Lilla Spelmanslag is a group of young musicians that play and perform Nordic folk music. We are a multi age group, with a wide range of skill levels.  Our unique group is not just about performing -- it is also about placing the music in its home culture, working with tradition bearers, practicing good musicianship, and sharing music as a way to build cross cultural friendships. That is why we are so excited to be heading to Denmark in the summer of 2017!

From farmer’s markets to dances, festivals to parties, our young performers are known for their danceable music, great energy, and their ability to produce great sound. We work in the traditional way, learning our tunes by ear, then adding both easier and harder harmony parts, always keeping an ear toward styling for dance.

For the past three years, we have worked to grow our knowledge about Danish musical traditions.  We have worked with visiting master musicians, learned tunes from many regions of Denmark, and learned some Danish folk dances as well.  But there is nothing to replace experiencing these traditions in the places where they originate.   Take the tiny island, Fanø, where we will experience homestays, where the line of musical tradition bearers has remained unbroken for 400 years.  This is a real, living tradition, carried  forward to the present, a rare entity!

Cultural connections are vital to understanding the music in its tradition.  Our experience of travel to Sweden in 2013 is still bearing fruit, as connections made there continue to flourish.  In this upcoming trip, too, we have structured our trip around making those personal, in depth, cultural connections.  We will do this both through homestays on Fanø, and our time at the Haugaard International Fiddle School.

Why the Haugaard International Fiddle School? The Fiddle School is an amazing opportunity for us.  We will be able to work with internationally renowned teachers from  multiple fiddle traditions to develop individual skills, and work on playing in larger ensembles.  Not only do students attend level appropriate classes, but they also do large group work with musicians of all ages. They work together with the teaching faculty to create tune arrangements, a skill that will benefit the Seattle Lilla Spelmanslag.  Finally, we will connect with young musicians from all around the world, including Germany, the Netherlands, Austria, Switzerland, Russia, Latvia and France.

The $5000 we raise from this campaign helps to offset the cost of the airfare, housing, food and tuition for our young musicians. We are committed to making the trip affordable for all of our young musicians who desire to travel with us.  

We have some unique and amazing rewards for our backers, including our most recent CD and opportunities for private concerts in your home.  In addition, by funding us, you are funding a piece of the future of Nordic folk music in the United States, helping us to inspire kids and keep the tradition alive. These young people are poised to carry their music with them as they move into adulthood, wherever they may land. This trip will give them a cultural framework, and build bridges and friendships for their futures as musicians.

You can follow our progress here on Indiegogo, where we will post regular updates.  We hope that you will give generously, and ask your friends to do the same to support this terrific group. Stay tuned (pun intended) and share the adventure!

story:
Short Summary

AthensHoplites, part of the KORYVANTES Association, are a dedicated swordsmanship Society, an non-profit Organisation, focused in studying and practicing the war arts of the heavily armoured Warriors of the Hellenic Worlds.  Our expertise dates back to 2008, when KORYVANTES Association initiated their Academically accredited work in historically accurate Phalanx formations and Classical-era armours.

Focus will be on reviving and practising Mycenean, Archaic and Classical era war arts.

We are starting a new initiative in the form of a Swordsmanship Academy in Downtown Athens, for which we need to fund expensive and specialised HEMA-style and non-commercially available training equipment.

We all contribute the project on volunteer basis. ​Key focus is to enable people of all income levels attend our sessions and develop themselves.

This is a private funding campaign, the HEMA Alliance is not sponsoring this campaign.

 

What We Need 

We plan to start our training sessions with 10 students classes. For each student we must provide full HEMA-style training / protection equipment in the range of 700 - 1000 Euros, as follows:

HEMA mask (200 Euros), fighting gloves / body protectors (100 Euros), custom wood Hoplite shields (300 Euros), training weapons-set (100 Euros) and optionally a heavy leather jacket (300 Euros).

Roughly we need to raise minimum 7000 Euros to have complete training / protection equipment for an initial team of 10 trainees.

The Impact

Our initiative focus on providing young people ways to find their way (physically and mentally) out of economy problems and help them integrate with society. With a huge unemployment rate of 30% in Greece, our initiative is a small contribution to society, as will stimulate young people to develop skills and escape dangerous routes. 

There is great interest from a lot of people for our swordsmanship sessions, but currently we cannot fund the costs of the required protection equipment and the start is very slow.

Your contribution will help us keep a very low monthly fee (only to cover the facilities expenses) and make our initiative accessible to low-income people. 

 

Risks & Challenges

Currently we operate in a sluggish economy with very few private resources available and no state support or funding. We have put enormous effort and resources in the project, but the associated costs of necessary equipment are prohibiting. Trainees have to fund by themselves the equipment and this limit the accessibility to people with significant financial ability.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Every contribution will help us achieve! Even small amounts will add-up to make a difference and change the lives of many people.

Even if you cannot contribute financially, please share this post to people or Organisations that could help.

If you feel that you can contribute our project with HEMA equipment - new (preferably) or used in descent condition, please contact us :)

Please check the available Perks. They are unique, museum-quality, handmade artefacts made by friends or members of our society. Sometimes they are objects of our private reenactment collection that we use to boost our campaign. Don't hesitate to ask us for more details.

Perk#1 - The AthensHoplites Helmet. Roughly 2 kilos of pure hammered coper and iron...

 

 

Thank you for your support

story:
From the Community to the Commonwealth.


Hello, I’m Nick. I’m a passionate community advocate and proud idealist. Growing up in Ottawa my whole life I've witnessed what can happen when you stand up for your beliefs and take action. 

That's why I’ve been selected to be a Canadian Delegate at the 33Sixty Leadership Programme in Malta. There, I will be meeting with refugees, non-profit organization and youth from across the Commonwealth to share knowledge and solve problems affecting individuals most in need. Now more than ever, youth must be part of the conversation on sustainable and equitable migration in the global village. This is why this programme is so dear to me.

With your support, you can ensure Canadian youth have a voice in this important dialogue while helping to cultivate young leaders in our community.

Going the Distance.

Having the chance to represent both my country and city among youth from across the Commonwealth is privilege I do not take lightly. However with this responsibility, comes challenges.

 As an international summit, the expenses associated with this experience can be high. That’s why I am looking for financial support to be able to attend on behalf of my community. Simply put, I am looking to raise 1000$ to pay for airfare to and from Malta.

 As a sign of my sincere gratitude for your support, I would be happy to recognize you as a community leader within my social media as well as the Common Purpose Alumni Network (over 50,000 people around the world)!


Local Leadership for a Global Impact.

Never before has the world seen this many refugees. As you read this, millions of individuals and families are escaping devastating conditions and doing their best to strive for a better future. While many countries have welcomed refugees into their homes, the current plan isn’t working.

Coming together from across the Commonwealth, the 33Sixty Leadership Programme will shine a spotlight on international migration. Engaging all aspects of the community, this summit is meant to share knowledge and develop strategies to improve the international flow and treatment of asylum seekers. I am asking for your support so that I can attend and represent our country, its values and the input of young Canadians.


Spread the Word. Amplify Young Voices.

With exactly one month to go before I leave for Malta, time is of the essence. With the clock against me to raise money for this cause I am pushing forward, full steam ahead.

In addition to this page I am reaching out to local businesses, community groups, non-profit organizations and my peers in order to have the opportunity to represent my city and Canadian youth to the world.

Despite this enthusiasm I understand that not everyone is in a position to donate financially. If this important dialogue seems like something you believe in I would really appreciate you sharing this page with your family and friends. By speaking up and sharing the news you can help amplify other young voices too.

story:
I’ve made plenty of mistakes in my life. I’ve missed appointments, said things I shouldn’t of said, and tripped on my shoelaces a couple of times. I’ve played hooky, told a lie and hurt people I never meant to hurt.

I’ve had a comfortable life, with a loving family in a city that loved me back (most of the time). I’ve also had my fair share of rough patches too, especially in what would be considered crucial times in my life. In high school, I made enough mistakes for the two of us, you AND I.

“I don’t like to focus on what’s not important to me, and frankly, don’t really care.”

That's what I told myself. In reality, I was just scared. Scared of failing. Failing in front of people who weren’t doing that, in opposition really, it seemed like they were thriving. I was scared of being embarrassed. Scared of living up to the expectation that I felt like I made for myself, a failure. I always felt like I had a lot of passion for a lot of things. I was afraid to try, but even more afraid to fail.

And that's the beauty of being human.

Because being human means that you do fail, and in reality, you should fail. The power and encouragement that we get from others empowers us to get back on our feet. Having humility doesn’t mean you’ve failed, it really means you learned and wasted no time in getting back up. I’d say humility is the new black.

So I guess this is where I introduce you to Hand In Hand, an organization I’ve created to raise awareness about poverty and homelessness in Austin, and look for creative ways to develop more sustainable ways of life for them. I’m excited to get to work with a group of like minded, passionate people, and hopefully watch this organization grow.

And to be honest, asking y’all for donations seems strange to me. Why should you feel the need to help out THIS organization? I mean, what have we even done so far, and what are we going to use the donated funds for? And to be honest with that question, it’s for stickers, it’’s for t shirts, it’s for anything that can help us spread this club. I think what draws me to that idea is that it's now not just an organization for me and my fellow members, but also something go you. By graciously accepting your money, I’m taking an oath of self responsibility. I’m pledging to give everything I can contribute to this project.

So as I embark on a new project, I feel as though being aware of humility pushes me harder. I’m surrounded by people that not only challenge, but help me grow. And as I take this organization to the web, I hope you can help by challenging me as well, and encourage me to grow.

story: We are the students of Post Graduate program Arts Management from Centennial College, Story Arts Centre campus.  We have an incredible opportunity to hold a symposium for the arts and culture community of Toronto on February 16, 2016. The theme of our Arts Ahead symposium is 'the Art of Collaborative Management', where we will bring together professionals from the creative industry who will discuss and debate cross-collaborations and co-productions happening within the sector. In today's arts environment, we cannot ignore the synthesis happening between a variety of arts. To further this discussion we need your help. While our wonderful guest speakers have volunteered their time and will be sharing their knowledge and experiences in the sector, we need your help to make this event possible.
