For one month each year, anyone can teach a course on just about any topic under the sun. And Bethel residents and neighbors from nearby towns can take courses for free.  Our goal is to share and showcase the many talents of Bethel residents, help local entrepreneurs spread the word about their skills and offerings, and bring more residents out into the community to meet, mingle, and explore the wealth of talent in our town.
Bethel University launched in March, 2014 for our inaugural semester.  It was an incredible success, with 18 courses and over 130 registrations!  The second semester of BU is already underway with registration open for 36 diverse courses and 7 new “meet-up groups” being offered this March.
Bethel is a town of about 2,000 residents spread over 45 square miles of hills and valleys in the Green Mountains of central Vermont.  Bethel University was created by the Bethel Revitalization Initiative (BRI).  We are residents and volunteers with a desire to help our small, rural community be as vibrant, fun, and inclusive as possible, even in the middle of snowy New England winters!  By funding our campaign, you will be supporting our initiative to keep classes free and therefore accessible to everyone in our community.     
What We Need Let's break down what we need in a bit more detail.  Bethel University is truly a community effort.  Organizers and teachers offer their time, resources, and expertise.  Teachers, local businesses, and the town generously offer venue space and supplies when possible.  Keeping costs to a minimum is a top priority, and while our costs are few, there are some.  Primarily: 

Class supplies:  Occasionally funds are required for supplies to make a class possible and accessible to all students.  For example, arts and crafts supplies, guidebooks and pamphlets, or general printing needs.
Printing Costs:  We print posters to hang around our community, as well as postcards that can be handed/mailed out, listing our class offerings and how to sign up.  We also print diplomas of participation for our graduates, especially our younger ones.  These diplomas are designed by a young community volunteer!  

Advertising:  We run a spot in the local newspaper as well, noting the course offerings and how to find out more.  

We're looking to raise funds for this year and, hopefully, future years to come.  This will help supplement the amazing support we have already received from local businesses and the New England Grassroots Environment Fund.

What You Get
If you are a Bethel resident or a resident of a nearby town, regardless of whether you donate or not, you have the opportunity to:

Register for any of the diverse classes that are being offered this year,
Meet new friends and neighbors, and share in our great community,

Teach a class next year! If you're interested, start thinking about ideas now!
Attend our graduation social at the end of March. 
Additionally, we have had interest from some other towns about replicating this idea, and we are happy to share what we've developed and learned.  Whether you are near or far, if you are interested in trying to make this model a reality in your community, feel free to reach out to us, via our website at betheluniversityvt.wordpress.com, with your questions.
  

The Impact
 BU is about community.  Our teachers are all volunteers from our community who are generously offering their time to teach courses.  They have a genuine interest in what they are teaching and want to share their knowledge with anyone else who is interested in learning about a particular topic.  Without them, there is no BU.  
In our first year (2014), 21 “professors” offered BU courses ranging from Zumba to vermicomposting, quilt making to BBQ.  There were 134 registrations by residents of Bethel and 10 surrounding towns. 75% of participants say they learned new information and 95% of professors say they feel more connected to the community.
This year we have 36 courses plus 7 meet-up groups planned, and we hit 100 course registrations in just the first two days after registration opened!  The response has been amazing and we're all encouraged and motivated to continue bringing the simple idea to reality for the residents and neighbors of Bethel.

We want this to be accessible to anyone in our community, regardless of age or income.  One of the keys to being accessible and inclusive is to remove any barriers that would prevent someone from signing up.  For this reason, we feel that classes at BU must be free for anyone to join.


Other Ways You Can Help

 If you can't contribute financially, we understand, but that doesn't mean you can't still help out!  There are many ways you can pitch in, particularly if you are a Bethel, VT resident or neighbor:  Share this effort online and offline, with friends, family, and groups you participate in.  Help us get the word out about Bethel University! Feel free to share our website as well as some great press we've received too!

Bethel University VT

We're on VPR!

WCAX




Consider volunteering to teach a class with us next year.  Everyone has something to share!  No college or teaching degrees necessary.  Join our mailing list!

Volunteer to help organize BU and participate in our planning sessions.  Join our mailing list to receive BU news and updates.

Find out more at our website:  Bethel University VT!

story:
HEY! DO YOU KNOW THE ANSWERS?

  1. Are we doing enough to enable optimum learning abilities in our children?
  2. Is the current school set-up the  best possible option to facilitate the learning process?
  3. Do we have state of the art facilities, methods and infrastructure to cultivate a progressive and competitive learning environment?    

WE DO! 

MEET ELITE SCHOLARS STEAM ACADEMY! 

At Elite Scholar's STEAM Academy we champion innovative learning approaches, we shape our learners into developed individuals capable of self reflection, and we challenge them via new experiences.

We are a successful school located in the Saint Louis Metro East Area.  We focus on the key subjects of science, technology, engineering, art, and mathematics  to ensure that our learners are well rounded in both personal and educational spheres. 

We want to expand by providing our students with the best tools possible to supplement their learning needs. We are looking to develop a fully functional recording studio and news room as well as other STEAM Learning Labs that will allow our students a more hands-on (industry specific) experience.

At Elite Scholars STEAM Academy we seek to instill in our learners the desire to take positive risks and work as a team. This is an ethos that we ourselves agree with and this funding campaign reflects that. Let's work together and build something tangible that will benefit the students at our school and allow them a strong foundation to build their own lives.


What We Need 

We believe the school children of today will have jobs that we cannot even imagine in the future. We need to prepare them for the 21st century with an education that works to understand the complex world in which we live. This education should give them the tools to understand and interpret the interrelated nature of our world.


In order to achieve our goal we need your support. Here's a breakdown of our funding needs, what it will be spent on, and how it will be applied:

BUDGET

Elite Scholars STEAM Academy Learning Labs

Description

Quantity

Unit Price

Cost

Science Lab

1

$40,000

$40,000

Computer Lab

1

$40,000

$40,000

Recording and Newsroom (Engineering Room-Video)

$ 12,000

$  1,200

Total

$315,000

Timeline for Implementation

Activity

Date of Implementation

Submit Crowd Funding

March 2015

Advertise Services

March-April 2015

Expect Funding Notification

March-April 2015

Submit Orders for Funding

March-April 2015

Begin first phase of renovation

May - July 2015

Hire and Train Staff

July 2015

Open School Doors

August 2015


If we don't reach our entire goal we will use what is raised to fund Elite's Learning Labs as best we can and/or purchase a more complex hands-on STE(A)M curriclulum to continue challenging our students to: 

 1. Creatively use science, arts, mathematics,and technology concepts and principles and applying them to the engineering design process.

2. Recognizing the needs of the world and creatively design, test, redesign, and then implement solutions (engineering process). 

3. The ability to apply rational and logical thought processes of science, mathematics, arts, and engineering design to innovation and invention.

 4. Understanding and explaining the nature of technology, develop the skills needed, and apply technology appropriately. 

5. Understanding and explaining financial literacy through management of funds, stock market, and investments. 

6. Understanding and explaining the fine arts through music, theatre, dance and martial arts

Our school’s curriculum will always be at the forefront in preparing for change within our world and educational system. Elite Scholars STEAM Academy will proactively plan and make changes in our curriculum and instruction to enhance and compete within an ever changing world. 

The students of Elite Scholars STEAM Academy will be active participants in their learning. It is our charge to actively engage each student in the development of their learning through hands-on experiential learning processes that focuses on individual strengths. 



The Impact

By contributing to our project you ensure that our students receive even better educational tools and you provide them with better prospects as they move towards their adult lives. We want to run a school that is consistently adapting to the needs of our fast moving contemporary world.

From our students perspective the recording studio and learning labs will give them an opportunity to explore their creativity in a new setting but it will also grant them scope to further develop their team building skills too. We want to challenge our students and we believe that this is an effective way to allow them to build their self esteem, take positive risks, and explore another avenue of commonality  with potential for innovation and self discovery.

Education doesn't have to be intangible. Instead, we can teach our youth through experience and hands-on exploration, which the learning labs provide. We can use our labs to record music, podcasts, radio shows, and a list that only ends at our pupils inmaginations.

The learning labs can also be applied in a more practical sense to benefit our students engineering lessons. This in turn allows us to grow as a school and expand our mission statement too.

Help us provide a form of autonomy for our young learners and share with us in the excitement of creating something new.

    Possible Risks & Challenges

    Building something is always a challenge and this is no exception. We need to find the right equipment, we have to train staff members, and we have to be aware of the potential pitfalls in implementing our plan.

    But we are a school driven by innovation, helmed by the mission to challenge our students, and we strive to take positive risks. This is an apt description for this funding campaign as well. Yes, there are challenges but we feel equipped to deal with them and we always reflect on what works, and what doesn't.

    In order to overcome our potential pitfalls we will switch gears readily when we find that our current methods are not completely effective.

    Our school has a small student population, a committed staff and a loyal parent base that will allow for necessary changes to take place. A framework for thinking skills will help students make sense of this ever-changing world.

    By building a learner-centered, hands-on environment at a school with rigorous academics, high standards at its core, and with participation from parents and teachers, we can ensure that the needs of the students truly come first.


    Other Ways You Can Help

    We know that money is only one aspect when it comes to implementing goals. If you would rather help out in other ways and you're in the area then please let us know. We are confident that there will be something tangible that you can do to help us create our recording studio.

    We also appreciate any social sharing too. If what you've read inspires you but you are unable to contribute then please post a link to this campaign on whatever social network you enjoy using.

    We know that team work and collaboration are effective building stones (it's what we teach our pupils) so let's work together and create something new, tangible, and beneficial together.

    Thanks for reading and check us out at www.ess.academy, facebook, and twitter!
    We at Elite Scholars STEAM Academy would like to thank you for your support.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Crystal Walter.  My background is in social work, particularly in adolescents and trauma.  I am working towards a master's degree in Global Community Development to broaden my horizon for my future work as a master's level social worker.  I love working with people and enjoy seeing the smiles brought through personal achievement.

The model taught through my program at Southern Adventist University enables developing communities to help themselves.  This includes empowering them to find unique ways to establish an income base to support themselves, their families and their communities.  I am currently working with a school in the village of Bwa Pen (Bois Pin), Haiti, to encourage parents to raise money for their child's education. 

I will be working with the parents to make high quality blank note/gift cards to be sold in the USA.  There are several missions groups coming into this community each year, which will enable us to transport the cards and new materials safely and without shipping costs. The potential to support every child within this community is achievable!  A child's education costs an average of $15 USD per month, however, this does not include food.  Sponsorships cover a small portion of the students, and this program could create enough revenue to sponsor every child, which would allow for funds to be used for feeding the children every day.  Most of the families in this community can only afford either school or food, so many children go hungry. 

The impact that this program can have on this community will reach generations.  Education is the gateway to our future and it is our responsibility to ensure that our future is bright and paved with well educated, responsible, innovative and caring  individuals.

What We Need & What You Get

I am setting the fundraising goal at $2000, but hope to raise much more.  The following is a breakdown of where all funds will go once raised:

  • $550 to cover airfare for my trip to Bwa Pen
  • $500 to cover my room/board, food and transportation for 1 month
  • $200 to cover my translator as I do not speak French or Creole
  • $150 to cover initial art supplies
  • $100 to cover internet, phone and miscellaneous costs for 1 month
  • All funds in excess of $1500 go directly to the group of parents to support their children and additional supplies to make more cards

Donate $50 or more, and one of the parents and their child will include a personal note inside one of their hand-made gift cards.  These cards are made out of USA quality materials and include traditional artwork of Haiti!

The Impact

Parents are coming together to create beautiful Haitian artwork on blank gift/note cards.  These note cards will be sold in the USA to support not only their own children's education, but all of the children within their community.  By giving parents the opportunity to build a sustainable income, it not only benefits the children, but the entire community.  The parents will gain a feeling of accomplishment, which will build their own self-worth and self-esteem, which will be passed on to their children.  The children will see that their parents are working hard to support them, rather than waiting for someone else to do it for them. 

While this can be seen as a simple art project to create unique gift/note cards, the larger, more impacting picture is community empowerment and growth. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Pray! Pray! Pray! Prayer is just as important as financial gifts.
  • Indiegogo offers share tools so you can spread the word!
  • Tell your friends, church, family and neighbors! Every child deserves the opportunity for a good education and a warm meal!

story:
B.A.Messenger Youth Ranch

•  B.A.Messenger Youth Ranch is a nonprofit that offers children and their families, who are at risk or homeless, a safe refuge where they can experience art mentoring, art classes, equine training, and equine-assisted therapy.  This mix of possibilities is offered free of charge for anyone to qualifies for the program.  We pick up children and families and bring them to the ranch where they are taught responsibility, respect, and offered confidence-building opportunities.  Each program is tailored for the unique needs, wants, and abilities of its participants.

•  Founder, Robbie Matthews, has an extensive background as a collage artist and entrepreneur.  Her fun funky wearable art uses scraps and remnants, which would be rejected or cast away, and transforms them into beautiful pieces with the help of God. Robbie has also worked with woman and children in the non-profit sector, and has seen first hand the struggles that families in poverty, at the hands of domestic violence, and homelessness go through day to day.  Her vision to create a refuge for children and families grew out of her desire to offer a safe environment where families could experience the healing empowerment that art and horses have to offer.  She has combined these passions and created B.A.Messenger Youth Ranch.

MISSION STATEMENT:

To offer at risk children and their families a safe environment where they will receive refuge, counseling, education, and life skills that will nurture their creativity through art mentoring and equine assisted therapies.  Our services will help to build integrity and character for all who attend our programs.

WHAT BEING A DONOR MEANS:

Being a donor means helping to create our new ranch and continue offer children and families programs they otherwise would not be able to afford.  It means you will be able to see a small program grow to serve a much larger community, and it means you will play a part in changing lives through your support!

WHERE WILL YOUR MONEY GO?

•  Overall we are hoping to raise $250,000 to cover the entire cost of the land, building our barn, studio, admin buildings, and all startup costs. 

•  We are seeking an initial $50,000 to help cover the cost of the down payment for our land.  Funds will also be used to cover start up costs such as purchasing a printer and office supplies for fundraising and necessary paperwork, as well as legal costs, administrative costs, and to start building our pole barn to house our horses.

AS A DONOR YOU WILL SEE YOUR MONEY IN ACTION BY:

•  Visiting our webpage to see photos of our progress as well as photos and videos of the children interacting with the horses and creating art.

•  Reading testimonials from children and their families in our newsletter and/or on our website.

•  Weekly updates through our email list, detailed explanations about where we are in the process of building our ranch, the work we’ve done recently with children and their families, what we have left to do, and who has donated to us at which level.

•  A visiting to our ranch at the grand opening!

DONORS AT LARGER LEVELS WILL ALSO RECEIVE:

•  $100+ level= T-shirt with our logo

•  $250+ level= T-shirt and mug with images of the children and horses and our logo

•  $500+ level= A customized B.A.Messenger bag, t-shirt and mug.

•  $1000+ level= A personalized visit to the ranch as well as a t-shirt, mug, and customized B.A.Messenger bag.

•  $5000+ level= A personalized visit to the ranch, t-shirt, mug, customized B.A.Messenger bag, and piece of art created by the children.

OUR STRENGTHS AND CHALLENGES:

•  Our board of directors are made up of amazing people who have business management, education, equine, art, and financial backgrounds.  We have composed this group of people based on experience as well as compatibility and willingness to uphold our mission statement.

•  Our largest challenges will be raising money and finding land where our new ranch will be located/properly zones for our non-profit.

WANT TO HELP IN ANOTHER WAY?

PLEASE FEEL FREE TO LEND A HAND BY:

Donating your time and talents! 

We need individuals who will help us run our webpage, help us clear the land, help us build our pole barn, take a shift to feed the horses and/or help muck the barn.

 We are also seeking individuals and companies who are able to hold fundraisers such as teaching a workshop or offering products when a portion of the proceeds will go to B.A.Messenger Youth Ranch. 

We also need individuals to donate equine items such as:

Feed

Hay

Saddles

Vet services

Equine blankets

Bridles

Feed/water troughs

Large buckets

Hoses

Pitchforks

Stable brooms

Wheel borrows

Halters

Lead Ropes

Body brushes

Mane combs

Riding helmets of all sizes

Art Supplies including but not limited to:

Tempra paint

Acrylic paint

Watercolors paint

Brushes

Canvas

Drawing Paper

Construction Paper

Scissors

Pencils (graphite and colored)

Erasers or all kinds

Rulers

Pens

Markers

Glue sticks/elmer's

Office supplies including but not limited to:

Computer

Quickbooks

Paper

Pens

Printer

Scanner/Fax Machine

Landline Phone

Binders

File cabinet

Desks

Desk chairs

Staplers

Three hole-punch

White board or chalkboard/chalkboard paint

We are happy to take any/all supplies that are gently used!

If you have any questions or wish to help us in other ways please contact us at beamessenger@gmail.com or lauraamessenger@gmail.com.

Please also follow us and share our Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, and YouTube.

Thank you for considering B.A.Messenger!  We hope you will join us, and keep us in your thoughts and prayers as we kick-start this amazing journey!!!
story_txt: B.A.Messenger Youth Ranch•  B.A.Messenger Youth Ranch is a nonprofit that offers children and their families, who are at risk or homeless, a safe refuge where they can experience art mentoring, art classes, equine training, and equine-assisted therapy.  This mix of possibilities is offered free of charge for anyone to qualifies for the program.  We pick up children and families and bring them to the ranch where they are taught responsibility, respect, and offered confidence-building opportunities.  Each program is tailored for the unique needs, wants, and abilities of its participants.•  Founder, Robbie Matthews, has an extensive background as a collage artist and entrepreneur.  Her fun funky wearable art uses scraps and remnants, which would be rejected or cast away, and transforms them into beautiful pieces with the help of God. Robbie has also worked with woman and children in the non-profit sector, and has seen first hand the struggles that families in poverty, at the hands of domestic violence, and homelessness go through day to day.  Her vision to create a refuge for children and families grew out of her desire to offer a safe environment where families could experience the healing empowerment that art and horses have to offer.  She has combined these passions and created B.A.Messenger Youth Ranch.MISSION STATEMENT:To offer at risk children and their families a safe environment where they will receive refuge, counseling, education, and life skills that will nurture their creativity through art mentoring and equine assisted therapies.  Our services will help to build integrity and character for all who attend our programs.WHAT BEING A DONOR MEANS:Being a donor means helping to create our new ranch and continue offer children and families programs they otherwise would not be able to afford.  It means you will be able to see a small program grow to serve a much larger community, and it means you will play a part in changing lives through your support!WHERE WILL YOUR MONEY GO?•  Overall we are hoping to raise $250,000 to cover the entire cost of the land, building our barn, studio, admin buildings, and all startup costs. •  We are seeking an initial $50,000 to help cover the cost of the down payment for our land.  Funds will also be used to cover start up costs such as purchasing a printer and office supplies for fundraising and necessary paperwork, as well as legal costs, administrative costs, and to start building our pole barn to house our horses.AS A DONOR YOU WILL SEE YOUR MONEY IN ACTION BY:•  Visiting our webpage to see photos of our progress as well as photos and videos of the children interacting with the horses and creating art.•  Reading testimonials from children and their families in our newsletter and/or on our website.•  Weekly updates through our email list, detailed explanations about where we are in the process of building our ranch, the work we’ve done recently with children and their families, what we have left to do, and who has donated to us at which level.•  A visiting to our ranch at the grand opening!DONORS AT LARGER LEVELS WILL ALSO RECEIVE:•  $100+ level= T-shirt with our logo•  $250+ level= T-shirt and mug with images of the children and horses and our logo•  $500+ level= A customized B.A.Messenger bag, t-shirt and mug.•  $1000+ level= A personalized visit to the ranch as well as a t-shirt, mug, and customized B.A.Messenger bag.•  $5000+ level= A personalized visit to the ranch, t-shirt, mug, customized B.A.Messenger bag, and piece of art created by the children.OUR STRENGTHS AND CHALLENGES:•  Our board of directors are made up of amazing people who have business management, education, equine, art, and financial backgrounds.  We have composed this group of people based on experience as well as compatibility and willingness to uphold our mission statement.•  Our largest challenges will be raising money and finding land where our new ranch will be located/properly zones for our non-profit.WANT TO HELP IN ANOTHER WAY?PLEASE FEEL FREE TO LEND A HAND BY:Donating your time and talents! We need individuals who will help us run our webpage, help us clear the land, help us build our pole barn, take a shift to feed the horses and/or help muck the barn. We are also seeking individuals and companies who are able to hold fundraisers such as teaching a workshop or offering products when a portion of the proceeds will go to B.A.Messenger Youth Ranch. We also need individuals to donate equine items such as:FeedHaySaddlesVet servicesEquine blanketsBridlesFeed/water troughsLarge bucketsHosesPitchforksStable broomsWheel borrowsHaltersLead RopesBody brushesMane combsRiding helmets of all sizesArt Supplies including but not limited to:Tempra paintAcrylic paintWatercolors paintBrushesCanvasDrawing PaperConstruction PaperScissorsPencils (graphite and colored)Erasers or all kindsRulersPensMarkersGlue sticks/elmer'sOffice supplies including but not limited to:ComputerQuickbooksPaperPensPrinterScanner/Fax MachineLandline PhoneBindersFile cabinetDesksDesk chairsStaplersThree hole-punchWhite board or chalkboard/chalkboard paintWe are happy to take any/all supplies that are gently used!If you have any questions or wish to help us in other ways please contact us at beamessenger@gmail.com or lauraamessenger@gmail.com.Please also follow us and share our Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, and YouTube.Thank you for considering B.A.Messenger!  We hope you will join us, and keep us in your thoughts and prayers as we kick-start this amazing journey!!!

story:
Anti-Corruption International (ACI) is an innovative non-profit organization aiming to bring together young people from around the world to research corruption related issues, share experiences and develop ideas in a constructive environment to fight corruption and to put pressure on institutions to implement anti-corruption mechanisms. We know that ACI can bring about revolutionary change in the world and we are determined to make a world free from corruption a reality.  


Here is a selection of ideas ACI stands for:

- Case studies and online workshops

- Broad public awareness 

- Corruption Cost Index

- International Anti-Corruption Court 


We are operating solely on voluntary work by more than 100 young people from the below countries (red). 

Nonetheless, we incur costs which we cannot pay without your support! ACI is headquartered in Norway but we encourage our members to set up National Chapters in their countries. To build up the infrastructure, register and connect to the community, we ask for 2000 EUR. 


Why not check us out on: 

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Anti-Corruption-...

On Twitter: https://twitter.com/AntiCorruptIntl

On our website: http://anticorruption-intl.org/


_____________________________________________________________________________

Please see below for more detailed information about ACI:

Our origin

The idea of ACI originated when students from over 100 countries came together at a student festival in Trondheim, Norway earlier this year. There, we traded ideas about corruption and discussed about feasible solutions. Being boosted with the optimism and positive energy of this event, all of us felt the need that we, as the future generations, have to do something big to significantly reduce corruption. We think that an organisation or better a platform bringing together young people with different educational backgrounds and different experiences of corruption in different cultures, is the best way for us to successfully fight corruption. 

Our objectives

Anti-Corruption International wants ...

  • To provide support to and educate young people about the destructive impact of corruption on societies across the world and indeed on human progress and development.

  • To build and promote a constructive global platform for young people to trade ideas and methods to tackle corruption in all its forms.

  • To investigate and do research on anti-corruption measures by using the main strengths in young people’s arsenal: a burning desire to bring about a positive change in the world, an alternative vision for the future, free from limitations or obstacles from the past and creativity!

  • To push political and economic actors to put in place robust anti-corruption measures.

We are certain that ACI brings forward the fight against corruption and delivers actual change to the world. But how will the organization look?  


Our basis of members will be divided into and work in chapters with local, national and regional focus to develop and exchange ideas about corruption. Simultaneously,  technology allows us to assemble and work in thematic committees, like e.g. Health or Education, to benefit from the exchange of topic specific ideas and experiences in a global environment.  


Our projects 

ACI has a variety of ideas we will be working on. Some examples are:

  • We intend to operate our own Think-Tank/Research Institution, e.g. looking at how technology can reduce corruptive practices.

  • With a Corruption Cost Index putting value on how damaging corruption is to specific societies and economies, ACI tries to provide an alternative to the Corruption Perception Index by Transparency International.  

  • ACI plans to develop policy suggestions to governments, international organisations and corporations on an anti-corruption charter based on scientific evidence on its capacity to reduce corruption.  

  • We will promote global anti-corruption campaigns and seek to raise awareness about the damage and indeed the cost of corruption across the world.

  • ACI intends to develop a corruption case studies database and provide online courses to address the education and awareness deficit regarding corruption.

  • Finally, ACI plans to create awareness within the group of young people with the introduction of an International Anti-Corruption Youth Day.


What we are giving back in return for your funding

ACI benefits the global society by ... 

  • Educating the world of the consequences of corruption and encouraging especially the youth to speak up and to shape a corruption free society.

  • Providing an international platform where all the youth can exchange their corruption stories, find solutions and gather their power to fight corruption.

  • Developing and campaigning for anti-corruption measures.

  • Collaborating with civil anti-corruption organizations.

  • Corruption destroys the opportunity for many communities around the world to benefit from development aid or indeed projects aiming to increase participation in education or access to healthcare, so by tackling the root causes namely: corruption we can secure a world where development is not lost in the pockets of a corrupt few.


We are currently registering as a non-profit organization in Norway and would welcome your funding for the development of our organization within the first 2 months. ACI's launch is accompanied by a selection of instruments to raise public awareness using social media, different kinds of campaigning, a web site, press releases and member recruitment promotions. Additionally, registration of our National Chapters is also an expense.   

If you have any questions about our fundraising & finance, please find more information here and contact information: http://anticorruption-intl.org/donate/

Also, here is a selection of media that featured our story: 

http://one-europe.info/corruption-an-incurable-tumor-that-kills-our-societies?preview=1 (English) 

http://iswib.org/anti-corruption-international.html (English)

http://eunetwork.lv/blog/2015/03/edgaras-katinas-we-want-to-see-human-rights-violation-will-go-down (English) 

http://www.indymedia.ie/article/105317 (English)

http://nyheter24.se/debatt/792704-det-ar-dags-att-resa-sig-och-saga-nej-till-korruption-i-varlden  (Swedish)

http://echo.msk.ru/blog/pirren/1515256-echo/ (Russian)

story:
Short Summary

My name is Shane Whitecloud. At the age of 38, with a full time job as a case manager for homeless veterans, a part time job as a On-Air DJ for Rock 104.5, a band, and raising a 5 year old...I decided to add to my stack of cards and attempt college. I made it through year 1 with a 3.8 GPA, and now starts year 2. But due to a low credit score caused by no insurance when I was diagnosed with Crohns Disease 3 years ago making medical bills stack against me, and never owning a credit card in my life, I was denied a student loan. As you can see from the picture, I need to cover at LEAST $5,612 for my tuition for year 2. 

What I Need & What You Get

I've never used Indiegogo before, but it was suggested that I try it, so here I am. If I can raise the $5,612 then my tuition should be covered until year 3. My expected graduation date for my Bachelor's Degree is in March 2017. Perhaps by year 3 I can reapply for a student loan and my credit may be high enough for acceptance by that time. I don't have much to offer as a reward, except that you will be helping me to further my education and at the same time allowing me to set a positive example for both of my sons so they understand that it's never too late to chase your dreams, and for that you will have my complete gratitude. I will also post routine updates on my progress in school, as well as guarantee that I will bring my GPA back up from a 3.8 within a year.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share! While I know quite a few people, there are many more that I personally don't know that may know me and be willing to help. Anything at all would be appreciated.

story:
Please support and empower my friend Kendall, who has just been offered the teaching opportunity of a lifetime . . .

Although much of his relocation cost to China shall be reimbursed by the school which will employ him, he shall require about 5000 pounds to make this transition from Edinburgh to Shanghai . . .

Starting the 1st of August, 2015, Kendall shall be the new teacher of Literature, Journalism, and Drama at Kang Chiao International High School in Kunshan, China ! yay !

For what are the funds needed, you may ask . . .

Visa Costs & Medical Exam . . . . . £ 1000 . . . . .

(applications, processing fees, and hard copies)

Personal Cash . . . . . £ 1700 . . . . .

(Chinese Immigration requires Visa holder to have this amount of personal savings in order to qualify for admittance into the Peoples' Republic of China)

New Wardrobe . . . . . £ 300 . . . . .

(young Kendall only has "hand me downs"

and general hippie garb)

Travel Costs . . . . . £1000 . . . . .

(airline ticket to Shanghai, travel per diem,

public transport)

New Laptop . . . . . £1000 . . . . .

(current MacBook is 7 years old & in her Crone zone)

Grand Total . . . . . £5000

If you wish to view a copy of the mutually signed official contract of employment before making a donation to Kendall's noble cause, then please feel free to email him and he will furnish you with a digital copy of said contract . . .

the45broadcasting@gmail.com

Also, if you wish to have your donation reimbursed, then please include your bank details in the email, and young Kendall shall be happy to reimburse the full amount of your donation after he arrives at his new post in Kunshan China . . .

the45broadcasting@gmail.com     

If you wish to learn more about the school at which Kendall will be teaching, then please drop this link into your browser for your perusing enjoyment . . .

http://www.kcisec.com/EN/index

Many thanks for your time and meditation upon the details of Kendall's crowdfunding campaign !

And a massive yawp of gratitude goes out to all who have chosen to donate from their heart, and help the dream come to life !

May all grace return unto you & yours 100 fold !

slàinte !

Om. . .

c

story:
We are Full Harvest Urban Farm, a people of color led urban farm in Oakland California that has become a space for folks to laugh and love together, reclaim the land and our need to eat healthy and fresh food. As we have developed we have seen our own personal transformation from just growing cannabis to a thriving urban farm, and believe it is a model that we can replicate for folks that are formerly incarcerated. The money received from the indiegogo will give us some of the operating costs to launch the pilot of Fresh Out and its first co-hort. We will be engaged in other fundraising efforts to reach the total budget for the program. 

Fresh Out is a radical leadership development program for formerly incarcerated people. It seeks to bridge the gap that currently exists in re-entry programs. The program is designed to be both transformative and healing as well as provide tangible skills that can be utilized at the completion of the program to obtain a job in either the horticulture/agriculture arena including the cannabis cultivation field or the social justice-organizing field.  

The first component is what we are calling the Sankofa process where participants can work out some of the trauma and internalized oppression that too many people fresh out of prison are dealing with often in silence or unknowingly. 

A political education track, we will deepen folks analysis about how to build power in our communities, the local political landscape and issues that impact their lives such as mass incarceration, food justice, housing rights and displacement. A large component of this will be addressing the “war on drugs” and its impact on communities of color.  

An additional component is the horticulture phase. Participants will learn indigenous farming  methods a style of horticulture design that seeks to engage the land in ways that replicate what exists in nature to lessen our negative impact on the land. In this aspect of the program participants will learn animal husbandry skills, propagation and tree grafting and develop cannabis cultivation skills.

story:
Garbage Childhood Insurance

According to the world bank, Indonesia is one of the countries with lower middle income rate.

The lack of resources they have become a cause to the poor in acquisitioning the nutrition, health as well as the education for the early childhood among the poor society. According to research, approximately 18% of Indonesian have their income under $2 each day.

In accordance to the UNICEF, Indonesia is the third biggest country for the children number who haven’t got their ammunition as well as the fifth biggest country who run up against the growth retardation which has a huge impact to their ability to develop their physical and mental potential on the whole.

I believe that education, health, and nutrient are human right. However, the fact that many people can not get education, health, and nutrient because they do not have enough money and expense to get the expensive access. Indonesia has a big problem in getting education, health,and nutrient for children. Many people can not get them well due to their finances.

Garbage is the best solution because almost everyday in every home produce unused garbage, so that all people can join our program.

Based on this background, Indonesia Medika has a new breakthrough to solve this problem by Garbage Childhood. It is a micro insurance program uses garbage as the finance source to get education, health, and nutrition to achieve early childhood development. What we do is make people mobilize their own unused resource as sustainable funding to improve the access of education and health for the early childhood among the poor society.

Our main principle is from Garbage Childhood Insurance (GCI) can make people to create their sustainable funding from their own resource to improve the access and quality of early childhood development program in the aspect of education, nutrient and health. In other side, being an incentive for people to start processing the garbage appropriately and waste entrepreneurship from the household.

Garbage Childhood Insurance is prototype from micro insurance system with the finance from garbage insurance scheme that can be replicated in another region as well as can be adopted as government program to expand its utilitty.


Healthy and Smart with Garbage

story:
Short Summary

RapidBio Systems, Inc. is developing a revolutionary new food borne bacteria testing systems which will give results in a matter of minutes! We have proof of concept and proof of principle showing our technology works! We need to optimize our test and then test our prototypes in real work conditions.

We are raising $150,000 to complete our test system and to get our testing system ready for critical field trials.  

Once we compete this critical stage we will be able to help decrease food-borne bacteria in food by detecting bacteria earlier in the global food chain.  Our test can be used in the growing fields, processing plants or anywhere in the food distribution chain. By using our test system, food producers and suppliers will be able to detect bacteria contamination faster and sooner so they can do something about the problem immediately...and not have to wait up to weeks to get the other tests results!  What a difference this will make!

My name is John Erickson and I am the President and CEO of RapidBio Systems.  I have been responsible for developing, commercializing and managing over 3 dozen scientific products with sales of over $3 billion in my career.  There isn't a bigger issue that we can help solve than this critical bacteria contamination issue. With your help and support we will be able to get this revolutionary testing system to market and start helping save lives!

What We Need & What You Get

Your funding will go directly to completing the testing system and getting it ready for important field trials with major global food producers and leading universities. Specifically, the funds will go toward expanding the lab, bringing in more technical talent, finalize the optimization of the system and producing the final prototype testing systems that are ready for the field trials

To say "thank you" we are offering you some cool perks:

   $25 - personal thank you acknowledging your contribution from the President & CEO

   $50 - T-shirt with RBS logo 

   $100 - Coffee mug with RBS logo 

   $500 - $50 Gift Card from American Express 

   $1,000 - Skype call with the RBS President & CEO

   $+2,000 - Private dinner with RBS President & CEO 

The Impact

The impact of our testing system on the food safety market will be significant! Fast test results will lead to products moving faster and safer through the food supply chain.  Hours, days and even weeks will be saved leading to a safer food supply for the world.  Just as point of care (POC) tests like doctor office tests, have improved health care, our testing system will have similar impact on food safety.  Results available quickly, when and where you need them most in order to make a critical decision on food safety.  I have been responsible for developing and commercializing numerous POC testing systems such as diabetic blood glucose tests and others on a global basis and have witnessed the significant impact these test has had in people's lives.  We can do the same with food safety with your help!

    Risks & Challenges

    Like every endeavor there are risks with what we are doing. It may take longer and more funding to get us to the field trials, out patents may be limited and after the field trials we may have to make additional changes to our system, in order to get it to market.
    Our system is designed to be used by people with limited education and skill out in the fields, processing plants and warehouses.  By designing the testing system right, we will be able to train users in a matter of minutes and without a technical degree!  During my 30 years of industry experience, I have led teams who have done this before and we will leverage this experience and critical learning for our unique testing system. Our team has the skills to do this!

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Even if you aren't able to make a financial contribution to our campaign you can still help.  Let others know what we are doing and ask them to check us out and make a contribution to help us change bacteria testing to improve the health of the world! 
      Don't forget to use all the Indiegogo share tools to make this happen.
      Thank you for all your interest and help in making a difference to millions of people around the world who are affected by bacteria contamination in their food!

Our team has the skills to do this!


Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you aren't able to make a financial contribution to our campaign you can still help.  Let others know what we are doing and ask them to check us out and make a contribution to help us change bacteria testing to improve the health of the world! 
Don't forget to use all the Indiegogo share tools to make this happen.
Thank you for all your interest and help in making a difference to millions of people around the world who are affected by bacteria contamination in their food!

story:
Picture a world where you are able to give back to a cause you believe in every time you make a purchase. Changing Lives Beverages is the beginning of that world. We are a company that aligns two basic needs by taking care of you our consumer and helping others in need.

Our Story:

Hello, and thank you for taking the time to read about our crowdfunding campaign!  Survival Energy Drink College Edition is a premier tasting, exceptionally quality energy drink that will function as the launch product line for Changing Lives Beverages.   Survival Energy Drink College Edition has been FDA approved and contains Acai berry which possess high levels of antioxidant and only 15 MG of sodium compared to similar products on the market that have an average of 105 to 150 MG of sodium.  This in turn makes Survival Energy Drink College Edition unique to all other beverages which are currently on the market.

That’s the skinny on the actual product, but in regards to our company, here’s what separates us from any other beverage company. Changing Lives Beverages will donate $3 to $10 of every case sold from our Survival Energy Drink College Edition to participating colleges in which the proceeds will go directly towards helping students pay their college tuition as well other related cost.  We are not hiding behind an undisclosed percentage of proceeds which are not quantified.  

….And that’s just the tip of the Iceberg.  Future product lines are already in development that will help fund and promote an array of causes that touch all walks of life.  From product lines that help fund and promote clinical research to a line of beverages that donates to causes such as First Responders and Environmental Services, Changing Lives Beverages mandate is to do just that, Change Lives!

Our subsequent beverage lines in development, but are not limited too, the following editions:

  • Graduate Edition -- The Graduate Edition primary function is to assist all college graduates in the task of paying off their college debts. Its secondary objective is to fund programs to assist college graduates in finding employment after they completed there studies.

  • Community Edition -- The Community Edition is geared towards stimulating economic growth to create jobs and assist non-profit organizations improve low-income communities.  Most importantly, the Community Editions aim is to help improve relations within the fabric of said communities by way of neighborhood outreach.

  • Humane Edition — The Humane Edition objective is to support organizations that fights for animal rights and brings awareness to animal causes. These translate into supporting animal protection legislation, operating campaigns to bring about reforms, performing animal rescue and emergency response, inspecting cases of animal cruelty, providing animal care at sanctuaries, rehabilitation centers, emergency shelters, and clinics. 

Impact:

Changing Lives Beverages is the only beverage company in existence through which every single product manufactured is actively giving back to health, social, financial, and safety issues on a global scale. By providing a quality beverage, we’re also providing our customers with the opportunity to easily give back to their local communities and local colleges, without having to take the time to donate on their own. Our customers, and our backers, can rest assured that the funding we receive is not only helping us create a company, but is also giving us the chance to give back to the rest of the world!

What We Need:

In order to bring our new beverage products to the retail market, Changing Lives Beverages needs your help! With this campaign, we are seeking funding in the amount of $200,000. This funding will go towards purchasing ingredients needed for product formulation, manufacturing and production. Further funding that is received through this campaign will be used towards the first production run, and help with both traditional and online/social media marketing. 

What You Get:

To thank our generous backers for supporting our campaign, we are offering a series of rewards based on your donation amount! Whether you can donate a little or a lot, we’ve got a reward designed just for you!

Risks & Challenges:

As with any campaign created to establish a new product, our campaign is bound to hit some bumps along the way. We may run into issues with supplying our production line with the right ingredients, sourcing manufacturing materials, or simply run into a snag or two finalizing the product itself before it gets ready for retail distribution. However, we intend to be completely transparent when it comes to the process, and with letting our backers know when we anticipate that we will be able to ship both the product and the rewards related to this campaign. While we are expecting to be ready for retail sales by September 2016, we will be sure to let you know if we encounter any delays.

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you can’t make a donation at this time, there are still ways you can help our campaign succeed. Please take a few moments to share our information and our product video with your friends and family via social media, email, and through word of mouth. With your help, we can get our product funded and into stores by the end of Summer 2016!  

Thank you in advance for not only your support , but also your time and consideration!

With your help, we can get our product funded and into stores by the end of Summer 2016!  

Thank you in advance for not only your support , but also your time and consideration!

story:
If you prefer tutoring in person, then find a suitable tutor with best review and meet up at home or in the library.




Children are our future, so help them to finish school as easy as possible. Our tutors will be available in any time, 24 hours a day, online or you can choose your location, select a tutor you like, simply pick your subject and get tutorial for any subject in school in person.

 Our platform will be for people who want to have tutorial, where you can stream with our tutors or just select location, select subject like math, English, German, chemistry and then you choose tutor.

Our goal is to connect qualified tutors with those who need help.

                                          


All of the tutors are highly educated. We are offering the best and the largest data-base of teachers which we will check constantly trough verification.

From each tutor we will demand first hour 50% of service and from each service we will charge 15%. If customer decided to buy more hours at once, it will be given for cheaper price. ( For example 1 hour is  equal 20 euros; 10 hours is equal 180 euros) They need to be available when needed. Calendar will be scheduled trough us.

After each session, tutors will always give you feedback, and we will be happy to receive every review from you.






It is really simple.






 If you are meeting a tutor by person, the location and time  are in your personal arrange. 
All the  tutors will be paid directly for every tutorial lesson, our fee its just 10% of each payment by each service.
We are also offering booking more hours of service for a special price.
After each session, tutors will always give you feedback, and we will be happy to receive every review from you.

TIMELINE





SPECIAL THANKS: 
Tamara Kocbek: Spelling, marketing, project view, general support
Miha Jakin: Video project
Miha Lebarič: Cooperation in video 
Katja Maleš: Images 
Pionirska knjižnica Rotovž: Place of videotaping

story:
Story: Nabil Abed lives in besieged Gaza city, this city which famous with its sons determination despite of all harsh conditions which has  surrounded for ten years.


Nabil Abed is 30 years old,  married and supporting family of 3 persons, he holds bachelor of Engineering & Information Technolog in 2009,in addition to many courses and activites.

Nabil works with a low salary which is barely enough to cove the basic needs of his family.

Why am asking for this funding?
Despite of the three wars that we experienced and siege that has raved in every aspect of our life i still have  a dream to complete my  study which is one of our basics rights   
although gaza city lacks the factors of life ,but i have great belief that you will help me.

What will be achieved from this goal?
Achieving my goal will make my family and friends proud of me especially I was able to face all inhuman circumstances that seek to destroy our dreams.
As I am trying to achieve self realisation and I will serve the Gaza society.

How can people help me?
I will be really grateful for everyone help through supporting ,contribute or sharing this campaign on the internet.

The required amount for studying MBA will be:
1- Study hours: 30 h  ,, 100$ per hour ,, total :3000$
2- Graduation research :2300$
3- Books,transportation ,printing some research cost:1000$  
total amount:6300$

story:
Short Summary

I am a recent college graduate and I am taking a stab at becoming an author to further my hope in becoming an activist and researcher. My background is in Environmental Biology, but there are so many more topics that interest me, too!

This is my first publication that I have completed all on my own. There have been many more steps to this process than anticipated! The funds collected for this project will go to the following:

*Printing

*Copyright and ISBN fees

*Establishing a publishing houseU

 

Itty Bitty is  a very small kitty with a very big problem--she isn't getting any bigger like her friends! Through this quick tale for children, Itty bitty the kitty  learns that the world needs all kinds and she is enough how she is and that big things come in small packages! 

A great easy reader for kids to learn more about self empowerment and acceptance.

This campaign can't work without you! Look to see how to get your own copy of Itty Bitty the Kitty! Please share this campaign and encourage the growth of small self publishers, while growing small minds to accept and love themselves and others for who they are!

XO AJS

story:
Short Summary

Inspiring Youth of Color is club we have created in our local high school with the goal of developing African American students. We are driven by the effort to make a change in African American education in the United States. Our goal as a club is to guide students at our school by mentoring them academically and socially, with the overall goal of getting them ready for post secondary success after high school in the college/university arena.

The Impact

We hope to make an impact in our community by developing our African american brothers in high school

story:
Our Story

  • I am Mary Broadaway, an attorney, State Representative and most importantly the mother of a 23 year old son with autism.  When my son was a junior in high school it became apparent that he was not a candidate to be accepted into a traditional higher education environment.  There were very few alternatives for him after high school beyond attendance in a traditional day treatment program with a local disability service provider or a sheltered workshop. Knowing that he was capable of more, we enrolled him in the only program in the state of Arkansas designed to give people with intellectual disabilities a college like experience.  That program was a geographic challenge being 5 ½ hours, by car, from our home.  Virtually at the same time, I ran for a seat in the Arkansas House of Representatives, a significant part of my platform based on advocating for individuals with intellectual disabilities. Due to the desire to provide more post high school options to students with intellectual disabilities, my partner, Janet Ragland, former general counsel  for  the Arkansas Department of Higher Education and mother of an intellectually disabled daughter, and I began drafting legislation to create Building Better Futures, which designs and implements fully integrated, but modified, certificated programs in institutions higher education for intellectually disabled students.  This legislation was passed, almost unanimously, by the Arkansas General Assembly in the 2015 Legislative Session as Acts 410 and 931.


What makes Building Better Futures Different

  • Though there are some programs in the country that provide intellectually disabled individuals a  "college like" experience, there are very few that provide specialized, marketable, transferable employment skills such as culinary/hospitality, daycare, certified nursing assistant or coding in an integrated setting.  Institutions of higher education have not typically been equipped to serve this population, because these individuals often need greater support then their typical peers.  Thus, there has been a hesitance in higher education venues to establish such programs due to the expense.  This campaign is designed to build a fund-raising platform so that the seed-money can be raised to provide the necessary tools for institutions of higher education to create and implement the above described programs.  These programs fill a tremendous void by integrating intellectually disabled individuals  first, into the higher education environment and then, into mainstream society through competitive employment, thereby providing quality, dignity and a sense of contribution to them.

(Broadaway Family)

 Building Better Futures is a WIN/ WIN

  • Integrated programs have proven to be as beneficial to typically developing individuals as to their intellectually disabled counterparts. The typically developing peers recognize the value, abilities and contributions that their intellectually disabled peers have and this creates the essential culture change necessary to the development of society. Due to the ever increasing number of individuals on the Autism Spectrum and developments in medical technology, there is a growing segment of our society that live with the challenges of intellectual disabilities and learning differences.  We must acknowledge these differences as a society and help these individuals find their place, provide them choice and opportunity, and enable them to contribute.



HELP US GET STARTED

Building Better Futures is a licensed internet portal which allows access to a "Turn-key" Model Tool kit to allow Institutions of Higher Education to create and implement their own unique programs.  This tool kit starts with designing   the program  and continues all the way through placing graduates in jobs related to their field of study. We anticipate it will cost close to a million dollars to create our tool kit, but we need the seed money necessary to allow us to conduct an intelligent, thorough fundraising campaign.

  • We are seeking to raise $25,000.00 to assess interest in what we are doing and for the following purposes:
  • $5,000.00 for grant writing/research
  • $5,000.00 for creation of a website
  • $5000.00 for professional fees
  • $2,500.00 for public relations and marketing
  • $2,500.00 for technical and consulting expenses regarding expense of creation and valuation of product
  • $2000.00 for rental of dedicated office/meeting space
  • $2000.00 for branding, design, and print materials
  • $1000.00 for registration fees

Other Ways You Can Help

For parents and family members of a future student, send us your interest and comments.  We want to hear from you. Tell us your story and let us know how to contact you so we can follow up with you.

For educators and Higher Ed organizations.  If you want to be a pioneer location that helps us get a program started, we want to hear from you.  Maybe you have a culinary program or work study program or you've been contemplating one of these, contact us.  Let's work together and build a better future for our communities.

For donors and sponsors.  We need your support.  Your assistance can be through funding, but also through donating a building, endowing a faculty members annual salary, providing operational tools, providing operating capital, providing your expertise, providing student scholarships, or other means that will help us build a better future for our communities.  We need to hear from you.

For business and future employers, we would love to partner with you.  We need your financial support, but we also we want to know about the communities in which you are located and your employment needs.  We want to help you enhance your business and build a better future for your community.

Finally if you want to participate in some way or just want to encourage us to continue.  We want to hear from you too.  We know we are on track to good things and knowing that you are behind us will keep us moving forward.
