story:
Child's Cup Full toys and accessories are handmade by refugee and low-income women in the West Bank. Our mission is to provide women artisans access to the global marketplace so they can provide for themselves, their families and their communities. 

Dr. Janette Habashi is the founder and executive director of Child's Cup Full. She grew up in the old city of Jerusalem and has centered her academic research on children's education and development in the Middle East. She has seen that the primary barrier to opportunity for many artisans in the West Bank is access to the international market, which is why she decided to build the Child's Cup Full toy brand with her students in 2012 at the University of Oklahoma. We currently sell our toys online and in stores across the US. Over the past year, we've received more orders than we can fulfill, which is why we need to build workforce capacity to keep the momentum going!

We need to raise $25,000 so that we can...

1) Train five new refugee and low-income women artisans in Zababdeh

2) Start training women through our artisan partners in Ramallah, Hebron and Bethlehem, which will enable us to scale up our operation in 2016 as we receive more orders. Our goal is to train and employ 30 women this year.

3) Buy necessary sewing machines, materials and equipment to expand our children's toy and accessory product lines


We know that building a brand and developing a successful product line is hard work. That's why we have organizational partners like Aid to Artisans and The Creation for the Creation of Economic Wealth, as well as a dedicated team of volunteer designers and marketing consultants to help us get Child's Cup Full toys and accessories in stores across the US and around the world!

Please help us spread the word about our campaign! 

The more funds we raise, the sooner we can train and employ talented women artisans in communities across the West Bank!
story_txt:
Child's Cup Full toys and accessories are handmade by refugee and low-income women in the West Bank. Our mission is to provide women artisans access to the global marketplace so they can provide for themselves, their families and their communities. 




Dr. Janette Habashi is the founder and executive director of Child's Cup Full. She grew up in the old city of Jerusalem and has centered her academic research on children's education and development in the Middle East. She has seen that the primary barrier to opportunity for many artisans in the West Bank is access to the international market, which is why she decided to build the Child's Cup Full toy brand with her students in 2012 at the University of Oklahoma. We currently sell our toys online and in stores across the US. Over the past year, we've received more orders than we can fulfill, which is why we need to build workforce capacity to keep the momentum going!
We need to raise $25,000 so that we can...
1) Train five new refugee and low-income women artisans in Zababdeh
2) Start training women through our artisan partners in Ramallah, Hebron and Bethlehem, which will enable us to scale up our operation in 2016 as we receive more orders. Our goal is to train and employ 30 women this year.
3) Buy necessary sewing machines, materials and equipment to expand our children's toy and accessory product lines








We know that building a brand and developing a successful product line is hard work. That's why we have organizational partners like Aid to Artisans and The Creation for the Creation of Economic Wealth, as well as a dedicated team of volunteer designers and marketing consultants to help us get Child's Cup Full toys and accessories in stores across the US and around the world!



Please help us spread the word about our campaign! 


The more funds we raise, the sooner we can train and employ talented women artisans in communities across the West Bank!

story:
Short Summary

The International Network for Research in Arts Education (INRAE) is committed to a vision of education in which the arts play a central and critically important role.

Our research has shown that:  The arts in education can be used to construct knowledge in other domains of learning; The arts can promote embodied learning;·  The arts can effect significant transformation in a young person’s life; Arts education can positively impact personal wellbeing; The arts are a powerful venue in which young people can construct and maintain identity; Arts education has potential to facilitate social cohesion and community building; Arts education can contribute to the goals of multiculturalism.

Since 2009 we have supported research in arts education by holding 6 international conferences and publishing 3 highly acclaimed Yearbooks.  We are now ready to produce our 4th Yearbook featuring important studies from around the world.  All we need is funding to cover the basic cost of publication.  We invite you to help us to achieve this goal.


What We Need & What You Get

We need 5000 Euros to cover the cost of publication for the 2016 edition of the INRAE Yearbook and to meet the related demands of this fundraising campaign.

We will proudly acknowledge your donation by publicly recognizing you in the 2016 Yearbook and on our website.  We will be very grateful for all donations ranging from 10 Euros (Friend) to 500 Euros (Champion) and beyond.  In addition, for every donation of  50 Euros or more, it will give us great pleasure to send you a copy of the 2016 International Yearbook for Research in Arts Education, as soon as it is published!  If you make multiple donations of 50 Euros or more, we will send you multiple copies of the Yearbook!

Impact

This is the first time that we are raising funds for the |INRAE Yearbook through crowdfunding and we are very excited about the possibility of using this platform to enable us to publish research in our field.

Why is research in arts education so important?  Because without solid research, educational authorities who are committed to evidence based decision making will find it difficult to commit valuable resources to learning in the arts.  Because improving quality in arts education requires in-depth study of the practice of exemplary teachers.  Because only through research will we know where the arts are being taught in the world, by whom, and with what resources.  Because all young people have a right to explore their cultural heritage and to exercise their creativity. Research has a major role to play in making high quality arts education accessible to all children and youth.

    Risks & Challenges

    The articles have been written.  The editing is well underway.  The Yearbook will be ready for the publisher very soon.  So, the only risk is that we may not reach our fundraising goal.  If this should happen, we will make every effort to find other ways to supplement your donations so that the Yearbook can see the light of day.  We have succeeded in publishing 3 previous Yearbooks, so we are confident that, with your backing, we will succeed again, this time.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Please help us to get the word out about this campaign.  Tell your friends and colleagues.  Circulate information through your networks.  Thank you!

story:
Ever wanted to start with microcontrollers, the simplest way?

Well, you've just found it!

Get one of our kits, fetch your soldering iron and start.

This project is very simple Atmel ATtiny85 microcontroller board that comes in parts, as a kit, so you can solder it yourself and then program it.

  • It is Arduino compatible which means you can program it with the familiar Arduino IDE interface.
  • Perfect for beginners - everything is so simple that there is almost nothing that you can get wrong.
  • Best startup kit for teachers and educators.
All the designs and source code are released under OPEN SOURCE licenses so you can use them, make modifications and share them freely.

Tinusaur, what's that?

This is the name of our project – Tinusaur.

It's a long story but in short – we started it around October 2013 as a prototyping board that we wanted to use to quickly build things with Atmel ATtiny85 microcontrollers and since then it had grown into a full-fledged project with a small but devoted community around it.

It consists of the following sub-projects:

  • The Tinusaur boards and the shields. This is the hardware. Everything comes in parts, i.e. it is a kit and you have to assemble it yourself

  • The step-by-step user guides how to assemble the boards. These are the video tutorials that we're preparing.

  • Beginners tutorials for how to write your first microcontroller programs. Blinking LED, reading push button, sensors, etc.

  • Cool projects using the Tinusaur boards and shields. These are things that really do stuff for you like thermostats, variometers, etc. Those are of hardware and software.

Why we need your support?

Over the past 2 years, we have managed to ship few hundreds of our kits to people all over the world. But it is more often that the demand is larger than the quantities we could supply.

We need to move this project to next level being able to keep quantities in stock as well as develop more boards, more shields, complete video guides, write more tutorials and make this project even greater.

Get your own Tinusaur kit and, help us fund this project.

What others are saying about us

  • Hackaday - THP ENTRY:
    TINUSAUR AVR PLATFORM TEACHES NOOBS, PLAYS GAME OF LIFE
    https://hackaday.com/2014/07/29/thp-entry-tinusaur-avr-platform-teaches-noobs-plays-game-of-life/
    [Neven Boyanov] says there’s nothing special about Tinusaur, the bite-sized platform for learning and teaching the joys of programming AVRs. But if you’re dying to gain a deeper understanding of your Arduino or are looking to teach someone else the basics, you may disagree with that assessment.

  • Atmel - Bits & Pieces
    Tinusaur dev board packs an ATtiny85 MCU
    http://blog.atmel.com/2014/12/01/tinusaur-dev-board-packs-an-attiny85-mcu/
    The Tinusaur — powered by an ATtiny85 MCU — is a simple, inexpensive and quick-start platform targeted at both Makers and developers alike.

  • Atmel - Bits & Pieces
    27 smart crowdfunding campaigns you may want to back this week
    http://blog.atmel.com/2016/02/26/27-smart-crowdfunding-campaigns-you-may-want-to-back-this-week-2/
    This ATtiny85 kit gives you everything you need to start your first microcontroller project. Tinusaur is currently seeking $1,729 on Indiegogo.

  • OSH Park
    Tinusaur: ATtiny85 Quick Start Boards
    https://blog.oshpark.com/2016/04/02/draft-the-t...
    Neven Boyanov from Bulgaria started Tinusaur Project in 2013 as a tiny platform to learn microcontrollers with the Atmel ATtiny85.

  • Embedds
    Attiny85 based Tinusaur development board
    http://www.embedds.com/attiny85-based-tinusaur-development-board/
    Tinusaur development board is small board with Attiny85 microcontroller. Microcontroller is DIP socketed so it can be replaced with other tiny micros like Attiny25/45 and 85 and their variations.

  • ATmega32 AVR
    The Tinusaur Project
    http://atmega32-avr.com/the-tinusaur-project/
    The Tinusaur is a small board with a ATtiny85 micro-controller on it. 


Still not convinced?

Here is more information about our project.

The Tinusaur Board is partially Arduino compatible and it could be programmed using the Arduino development environment.

What could you learn?

It is very simple. In fact, it is so simple that there are few thing you can get wrong.

It allows enthusiasts to learn many things:

  • Learn how to solder components on a PCB board by following step-by-step video tutorials.

  • Learn the basic principles of microcontroller programming in C/C++.

  • Learn how to write simple programs to turn on and off an LED but also, write a bit more complicated programs that read external signals.

What else could you do with it?

Simple things like blinking LED, experimenting with push-buttons, photo-resistors, buzzers, etc. But also, connect some external sensors for temperature, humidity, atmospheric pressure or connect external devices like relays.

Our Perks

Wandering what do you get? Here is more detailed information.

Tinusaur PCB

This is just the PCB in case you have all the necessary components at Find more information at:
http://tinusaur.org/products/tinusaur-pcb/


Tinusaur Board

This is the Tinusaur PCB plus all the necessary components to assemble it.

NOTE: It does not include the USB-ASP ISP programmer that you need to upload the programs from your computer to the microcontroller.




Find more information at:
http://tinusaur.org/products/tinusaur-board/

Tinusaur Starter 2

This is the Tinusaur PCB plus all the necessary component to assemble it.

(basically, it includes all the above)

It does include the USB-ASP ISP programmer that you need to upload the programs from your computer to the microcontroller.

It also has the Tinusaur Shield LEDx2 that has 2 LEDs and 2 resistors.


This is a great kit to start with. It has everything you need to write your first program and to upload it to the microcontroller.



Find more information at:
http://tinusaur.org/bundles/tinusaur-starter-2/

Tinusaur Starter EDU

This is the Tinusaur PCB plus all the necessary component to assemble it.

It does include the USB-ASP ISP programmer that you need to upload the programs from your computer to the microcontroller.

(basically, it includes all the above, less the LED shield)

In addition, it has the Tinusaur Shield EDUx4IO that gives you a push-button, LED, buzzer, and photo-resistors.

This is a great kit to start with to write your first program and to go little further with microcontrollers.

Find more information at:
http://tinusaur.org/bundles/tinusaur-starter-edu/

Tinusaur Starter Pro

This is the Tinusaur PCB plus all the necessary component to assemble it.

It does include the USB-ASP ISP programmer that you need to upload the programs from your computer to the microcontroller.

It also has the Tinusaur Shield LEDx2 that has 2 LEDs and 2 resistors.

In addition, it has the Tinusaur Shield EDUx4IO that gives you a push-button, LED, buzzer, and photo-resistors.

(basically, it includes all the above)

As an extra you get the USB-to-Serial converter and the necessary cables that you can use to send data from your microcontroller back to your computer through the USB port. Great for debugging and data acquisition.

This is great kit not only to start with but also to do some professional work with microcontrollers.

Find more information at:
http://tinusaur.org/bundles/tinusaur-starter-pro/

Tinusaur Starter XXL

This advanced starter kit includes 5 Tinusaur Boards - 5x PCB with all the necessary component to assemble them.

It does include 1 USB-ASP ISP programmer that you need to upload the programs from your computer to the microcontroller.

It also has 1 Tinusaur Shield LEDx2 that has 2 LEDs and 2 resistors.

It has 1 Tinusaur Shield EDUx4IO that gives you a push-button, LED, buzzer, and photo-resistors.

It comes with 1 USB-to-Serial converter and the necessary cables that you can use to send data from your microcontroller back to your computer through the USB port. Great for debugging and data acquisition.

(basically, it includes all the above)

This is great kit not only to start with but also to do some professional work with microcontrollers while having more spare boards available.

Find more information at:
http://tinusaur.org/bundles/tinusaur-starter-xxl/




And again ...

Please, help us
take this project
off the ground


-- This is one of our workshops in an university.

Additional technical information


Here is the list of everything included in the Tinusaur Board:

Name Description
PCB Tinusaur PCB
MCU, Attiny85 Atmel AVR ATtiny85 microcontroller
Socket, DIP-8 DIP-8 socket for MCU
H1, Header Header 2×4, Female
H2, Header Header 2×5, Female
ISP, Header Header 2×5, Male, for ISP
RESET, Button Tactile push button, for RESET
Power, Header Header 1×2, Male, for external power
Battery, Header Header 1×2, Male, for battery power on/off
Battery, Jumper Jumper, 2-pin, for battery power on/off
C1, Capacitor Capacitor 100nF, Small
C2, Capacitor Capacitor 100uF, Low profile 5×5 mm
R1, Resistor Resistor 10K, Small, 1/8W
Battery holder Battery holder for CR2032
Battery 3V Battery 3V, CR2032

story:
ENGLISH

Brief summary in English for our foreign contributors: Stoned Philosophy will be Sweden's first (and so far only) cannabis webcast where cannabis will be consumed openly over the discussions of trending topics. Scandinavian, international guests, musical artists and comedians will be invited to attend the show. There will also be reviews of products, strains, cooking segment, growing advice etc. There will be a total of 8×45-60 minutes episodes.

The show is part of the initiative Normalisera Mera (Normalize More), a campaign that Wally Johnson started two years ago, with the purpose to normalize cannabis and it's users. Since this is a jaw dropping topic in Sweden the show is guaranteed to stir up controversy. 

We have some interesting perks for companies that wish to contribute to the cause and get some exposure at the same time. We've calculated conservatively that each episode has the potential to attract at least 40-50 000 views. And that's a very conservative estimate. Most likely each episode will gather 100 000 + views based on our extensive network, marketing, media exposure and not to mention foreign audience.

We thank you in advance for your support!


SVENSKA

Varje dag träffas hundratusentals människor i Sverige, socialt, för att konsumera cannabis och snacka skit, precis som när man går på fika eller tar en drink tillsammans med några vänner. Men det är om man har lyxen att bo i en större ort där det är lättare att hitta likasinnade eller om man har haft turen att bo i en Stoner Village med massa hippies och annat trevligt folk. 

Dessvärre för många andra cannabisbrukare så är de förpassade till ensamhet eller en liten, gedigen skara vänner. Stigmat kring cannabis, ett resultat av 40 års repressiv drogpolitik, sitter så djupt rotat i svenska brukare att våga tala öppet om sitt bruk kan leda till rättsliga och sociala konsekvenser. Ännu mindre vill man då träffas för många och röka upp i sin lägenhet just av rädslan att en granne kan känna lukten och ringa på polisen på en. Detta har lett till en stereotypisk nidbild av den svenska cannabisbrukaren att vara asocial, passiv, aldrig vilja gå ut eller bara "håller sig till sina egna". 

Stoned Philosophy är videopodcasten där populära ämnen kommer diskuteras medan cannabis konsumeras öppet och tydligt, just för att visa en motpol till den ovannämnda stereotypen. Som sagt, detta är normalt och något hundratusentals svenskar redan gör idag. Vi kommer bara helt enkelt filma det och låta allmänheten se hur det ser ut när vuxna människor konsumerar cannabis under kontrollerade former. Inget konstigt alls. 

8 avsnitt på ca 45-60 minuter med potentialen att det kommer göras ett bonusavsnitt som ska utspela sig på midsommar. Fokusen kommer dock inte ligga på självaste konsumtionen av cannabis, utan snarare ämnena som kommer diskuteras. Både nationella och internationella gäster kommer besöka showen, samt musikaliska akter, komiker och annat relevant folk. Vi kommer ha cannabisrelaterade inslag som tex reviews av olika strains, vaporizers, pipor, bongar, matlagningsprogram, resemål mm.

Er värd kommer vara ingen mindre än Wally Johnson som kommer få hjälp av ett produktionsteam på fyra personer. 



Wally Johnson är en självaktualiserad filmskapare, underhållare och aktivist som skapat kontrovers de senaste åren genom att öppet tala om sitt cannabisbruk, förespråkande utav en full legalisering och hans kommande pro-cannabis dokumentär, Mary & I. 



Sedan 2014 har Wally varit fullt aktiv med att normalisera bruket av cannabis med sin kampanj "Normalisera Mera". Han har haft som intention att oblygt få svensken att bekanta sig med plantan och acceptera att cannabis är här för att stanna. 

 

Ett axplock av normaliseringen Wally ägnat sig åt de senaste åren.

  • Som nämnt i Magnus Lintons storsäljande bok, "Knark" var Wally instrumental i Jens Waldmanns historiska rättegång, Augusti 2014. En rättegång som startade den trend vi ser nu med svenskar som öppet går ut i media och protesterar sina cannabisdomar mm. Nyheten om Jens nådde internationella medier som bland annat VICE News etc.


  • Samma år blev Wally administratör och ansiktet utåt för den 25 000 stora Facebookgruppen Avkriminalisera Cannabis (AKC) och skapade rubriker när AKC bokstavligen samlade in hundratusentalskronor till SRs Musikhjälpen 2014, men vart ändå nekade all sorts mediautrymme.

  • Gemensamma krafter med Wally bakom spakarna så ordnades det en officiell visning av "The Culture High" i Malmö, våren 2015 där Adam Scorgie joinade eventet via Skype, men innan dess vart det en paneldiskussion. Med namn som Ted Goldberg, Khodr "Cutter" Mehri, Nelly Fredlund, Kamal El Salim, Ehsan Noroozi mm blev eventet väl omtalat och första av sitt slag. 
     
  • Sommaren 2015 blev det en kort, men lyckad, AKC-turné med syftet att visa att rörelsen är riktiga människor och inspirera till aktivism. Blev ett trevligt häng i Göteborg och i Malmö avtäcktes en gemensam AKC/Mary & I målning på en av Malmös mest populära väggar som i sin tur skapade snack i media. 
     

  • Och sist men inte minst,  Mary & I. En film Wally spelat in parallellt med sin aktivism under dessa år. Wally hoppas att dokumentären ska få Sverige att öppna ögonen för cannabis sanna potential. Liknande dokumentär existerar inte just nu i Sverige och det är en av anlendingarna till att Wally fått den exponeringen han får. Han gör helt enkelt det alla andra inte vågar.
     

    Vad behöver vi er hjälp med?

    Det vore en underdrift att påstå att publiken för den här showen inte finns. Det enda krav vi har är att göra ett bra jobb och det är därför vi ber om er hjälp. 50 000 kronor (€5000) är det minsta vi kommer behöva för att kunna fullfölja det här projektet till den kapaciteten vi önskar. Om man kanske inte är van vid filmproduktion så kan det låta mycket. Men det rör sig om hundratals timmars av arbete före, under och efter inspelning, för fem personer. 

    Wally Johnson kommer göra det här pro-bono men då hans produktionsteam har heltidsjobb som de måste ta ledigt ifrån för att kunna spela in showen så blir det svårt att inte erbjuda de något för förlorad arbetstid. 

    - 20 000 kronor, symboliskt arvode för produktionsteamet för 10 dagars arbete. Teamet består utav en kameraman, ljudtekniker och produktionsassistent/koordinator samt en co-host.

    - 8 000 kronor, lokalhyra för 8 dagars inspelning.

    - 7000 kronor, transport, mat, produktionskostnader för gäster, produktionsteam mm.

    - 5000 kronor, post production. Redigering, ljudmixning, färgkorrigering mm. 

    - 5000 kronor, NormaliseraMera.se hemsida + marknadsföring utav podden
    - 5000 kronor, oförutsedda utgifter som man kommer på under processens gång.

    April 2016 väntas avsnitten spelas in och intentionen är att det ska sändas i Maj/Juni tillsammans med lansering av hemsidan.

     

     

     

    Perks för både privatpersoner och företag. 

    Som ni ser till höger om sidan så har vi massor av roliga perks till de som väljer att crowdfunda oss. Vi har gjort så det finns något för alla i alla priskategorier.

    Även företag som vill synas i showen kan välja att stödja projektet och få exponering samtidigt. Vi har räknat konservativt att varje avsnitt har som pontential att dra minst 40-50 000 views. Det är väldigt konservativt räknat. Varje avsnitt kommer förmodligen få 100 000 + views, baserat på  vårt extensiva nätverk, marknadsföring, media exponering och utländsk publik.

    Med er hjälp kan vi göra produktionen så välgjord som möjligt och kanske om allt går bra, så blir det en andra säsong. Skriv till oss om det skulle vara någon speciell deal du är ute efter utöver det som är listat . Vi är flexibla och kreativa!

     

    Om du donerar via SWISH, glöm ej heller att skriva vilken perk du vill ha!

    Exempel på perks.
     

     

     

     

     

     

     

     

     

    Andra sätt du kan hjälpa om du inte kan donera

    Simpelt! Sprid skiten ur den här Indiegogo-länken. Du kanske sprider den till någon som faktiskt råkar ha pengar att donera. Man vet aldrig? Du kanske har en blogg med många läsare som hade velat se en sån här show hända? 

    Vi uppskattar all sorts hjälp och tackar på förhand. 

     

    NUVARANDE PARTNERS OCH SPONSORER

     

     

     

     


    Avkriminalisera Cannabis

    VitaMoln.com

    Rolling Gear
story_txt:
ENGLISH
Brief summary in English for our foreign contributors: Stoned Philosophy will be Sweden's first (and so far only) cannabis webcast where cannabis will be consumed openly over the discussions of trending topics. Scandinavian, international guests, musical artists and comedians will be invited to attend the show. There will also be reviews of products, strains, cooking segment, growing advice etc. There will be a total of 8×45-60 minutes episodes.The show is part of the initiative Normalisera Mera (Normalize More), a campaign that Wally Johnson started two years ago, with the purpose to normalize cannabis and it's users. Since this is a jaw dropping topic in Sweden the show is guaranteed to stir up controversy. We have some interesting perks for companies that wish to contribute to the cause and get some exposure at the same time. We've calculated conservatively that each episode has the potential to attract at least 40-50 000 views. And that's a very conservative estimate. Most likely each episode will gather 100 000 + views based on our extensive network, marketing, media exposure and not to mention foreign audience.We thank you in advance for your support!

SVENSKAVarje dag träffas hundratusentals människor i Sverige, socialt, för att konsumera cannabis och snacka skit, precis som när man går på fika eller tar en drink tillsammans med några vänner. Men det är om man har lyxen att bo i en större ort där det är lättare att hitta likasinnade eller om man har haft turen att bo i en Stoner Village med massa hippies och annat trevligt folk. Dessvärre för många andra cannabisbrukare så är de förpassade till ensamhet eller en liten, gedigen skara vänner. Stigmat kring cannabis, ett resultat av 40 års repressiv drogpolitik, sitter så djupt rotat i svenska brukare att våga tala öppet om sitt bruk kan leda till rättsliga och sociala konsekvenser. Ännu mindre vill man då träffas för många och röka upp i sin lägenhet just av rädslan att en granne kan känna lukten och ringa på polisen på en. Detta har lett till en stereotypisk nidbild av den svenska cannabisbrukaren att vara asocial, passiv, aldrig vilja gå ut eller bara "håller sig till sina egna". Stoned Philosophy är videopodcasten där populära ämnen kommer diskuteras medan cannabis konsumeras öppet och tydligt, just för att visa en motpol till den ovannämnda stereotypen. Som sagt, detta är normalt och något hundratusentals svenskar redan gör idag. Vi kommer bara helt enkelt filma det och låta allmänheten se hur det ser ut när vuxna människor konsumerar cannabis under kontrollerade former. Inget konstigt alls. 8 avsnitt på ca 45-60 minuter med potentialen att det kommer göras ett bonusavsnitt som ska utspela sig på midsommar. Fokusen kommer dock inte ligga på självaste konsumtionen av cannabis, utan snarare ämnena som kommer diskuteras. Både nationella och internationella gäster kommer besöka showen, samt musikaliska akter, komiker och annat relevant folk. Vi kommer ha cannabisrelaterade inslag som tex reviews av olika strains, vaporizers, pipor, bongar, matlagningsprogram, resemål mm.Er värd kommer vara ingen mindre än Wally Johnson som kommer få hjälp av ett produktionsteam på fyra personer.  Wally Johnson är en självaktualiserad filmskapare, underhållare och aktivist som skapat kontrovers de senaste åren genom att öppet tala om sitt cannabisbruk, förespråkande utav en full legalisering och hans kommande pro-cannabis dokumentär, Mary & I. Sedan 2014 har Wally varit fullt aktiv med att normalisera bruket av cannabis med sin kampanj "Normalisera Mera". Han har haft som intention att oblygt få svensken att bekanta sig med plantan och acceptera att cannabis är här för att stanna.

Som nämnt i Magnus Lintons storsäljande bok, "Knark" var Wally instrumental i Jens Waldmanns historiska rättegång, Augusti 2014. En rättegång som startade den trend vi ser nu med svenskar som öppet går ut i media och protesterar sina cannabisdomar mm. Nyheten om Jens nådde internationella medier som bland annat VICE News etc.

Samma år blev Wally administratör och ansiktet utåt för den 25 000 stora Facebookgruppen Avkriminalisera Cannabis (AKC) och skapade rubriker när AKC bokstavligen samlade in hundratusentalskronor till SRs Musikhjälpen 2014, men vart ändå nekade all sorts mediautrymme.

Blev ett trevligt häng i Göteborg och i Malmö avtäcktes en gemensam AKC/Mary & I målning på en av Malmös mest populära väggar som i sin tur skapade snack i media.  

Och sist men inte minst,  Mary & I. En film Wally spelat in parallellt med sin aktivism under dessa år. Wally hoppas att dokumentären ska få Sverige att öppna ögonen för cannabis sanna potential. Liknande dokumentär existerar inte just nu i Sverige och det är en av anlendingarna till att Wally fått den exponeringen han får. Han gör helt enkelt det alla andra inte vågar.

story:
#FiredUpForLiteracy Campaign Summary

Chicago has one of the lowest adult literacy rates in the country at 53%.  Falling behind and losing confidence begins at an early age.  Reading In Motion’s mission is to get every student reading at grade level by the end of first grade.  Research supports that reading at grade level by the end of first grade puts kids on a more successful path to high school graduation, helping them avoid incarceration, unemployment and poverty as an adult.

As a nonprofit, we have the ability to raise financial support to make innovation happen in schools, even in the midst of turbulence. This campaign goal of $100,000 is aimed at supporting our effective literacy program in schools around the city, amid Chicago Public Schools (CPS) and Illinois state budget issues that can diminish focus on the students.  Your gift will support our literacy program in eight specific Chicago public schools.

YOUR IMPACT

Research says, if a student is NOT reading at grade level by the end of 1st grade, they face a high risk of not graduating from high school, resulting in:

  • 85% likelihood to get in trouble with the law
  • 50% likelihood to get caught up in substance abuse
  • 3 times more likely to be unemployed
  • 6 times more likely to live in poverty

Currently, 82% of Reading In Motion students reach grade-level reading compared to the overall CPS average of 61% in kindergarten and first grade.  The impact is profound and lasting:

  • Kids loving to learn and loving to read
  • A significant increase in kids reading at grade-level
  • A brighter path for a brighter future for these students and our community

Enjoy some mission-related PERKS for being a part of the cause based on your level of support!

  • CD or MP3’s of Reading In Motion original songs to help your kids or grand-kids practice and master foundational reading skills
  • A shout-out on social media
  • A “video thank you” from a classroom at one of the 8 schools you are supporting
  • A chance to see a classroom in action

Risks and Challenges: Join Our Effort to Get The Word Out

Reading In Motion has a limited network of individuals to reach out to for support.  A majority of funding comes from foundation grants, followed by corporate giving.  We built our strategy for this campaign to compensate for this limitation.  You can be a part of its success!  Watch a video on social media, posted with #FiredUpForLiteracy that mentions our campaign and see what we are talking about.

Over 50 volunteer spokespeople have been recruited to get the word out to their own networks. David Eigenberg, Kara Kilmer, Miranda Rae Mayo, Kurt Ehrmann and Robyn Coffin of “Chicago Fire”, Antione McKay and Sara Sevigny of “Empire”, Donald Faison of “Scrubs”, Tim Kazurinsky of "Police Academy & SNL", Tony Award winner, Jessie Meuller, starring in the Broadway musical "Waitress" and the touring cast of “Jersey Boys” have joined a respected group of Chicago actors, musicians and teachers including Steppenwolf ensemble members, James Vincent Meredith and Francis Guinan in sharing short videos highlighting the importance of reading in their own lives and careers as well as sharing what they are reading.

WE CHALLENGE YOU to do the same:

    1. Upload your video to social media from your phone (YouTube, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc)
    2. Post it on your social media pages.  Link Reading In Motion to your post so we can share it as well.
    3. Include the following messaging in your post to give the viewer the information they need to support this Indiegogo campaign: Get #FiredUpForLiteracy for Chicago Kids @ReadingInMotion. Give today: http://bit.ly/RIMindiegogo
    4. Continue to post weekly throughout the campaign.
    5. Mix it up and have fun.

Campaign Details - $100,000 Supporting Literacy for Chicago Kids

Typically Reading In Motion requires the school to invest in 25% of the cost of the program to help strengthen the school’s commitment to successful implementation and 75% is covered by donors. However, the uncertainty of the CPS and Illinois state budgets make it challenging for schools to try innovative solutions. The #FiredUpForLiteracy campaign has a $100,000 goal to support 100% of the cost of the program in a select number of schools that have never tried Reading In Motion before.  Experiencing the results will shape how they decide to invest in their students the following year.

YOUR GIFT WILL SUPPORT Reading In Motion’s literacy program in 18 Kindergarten classrooms in 8 Schools across Chicago

  • Lawndale Elementary (Lawndale)
  • Tilton Elementary (Garfield Park)
  • Lowell Elementary (Humboldt Park)
  • Nicholson STEM Academy (Englewood)
  • Manierre Elementary (Old Town/Cabrini Green)
  • Funston Elementary (Logan Square)
  • Gray Elementary (Portage Park)
  • Davis Elementary (Brighton Park)

These schools have a combined average of 97% on free and reduced lunch (an indicator of low-income households) - Compared to the national average of 51%

The designation of your support will be the same, regardless if we reach the goal.  If we exceed our goal, your gift will support our literacy program in the remaining 31 Chicago public schools we currently serve.

More About Reading In Motion

Reading In Motion is a nonprofit 501 c3 organization based in Chicago for over 30 years that gets students reading at grade level or above within the first years of school, especially those students whose environment or circumstances put them in greater need of support. The organization is currently serving over 5,000 kindergarten and first grade students in 39 Chicago public schools with approximately 90% on free and reduced lunch. 

This engaging, innovative literacy model has been referenced by Harvard researchers, published in four peer reviewed journals and validated through ten outside studies. It uses music, drama and movement to engage students and accelerate learning and is designed in both Spanish and English. Reading In Motion collaborates with teachers, training and supporting them to measurably improve students’ reading, and builds basic, crucial reading skills early to start students on the path for a lifetime of successful learning. This literacy program increases the number of students reading at grade level from CPS overall kindergarten and first grade average of 61% to 82% in Reading In Motion classrooms (2014-2015 school year data). The program’s value is consistent and results in thousands more students reading at grade level.

A daily dosage of engaging arts-based literacy curriculum throughout the school year is an effective and measurable approach. Reading In Motion provides well-rounded support to ensure success: 

  • Provides summer training and teacher support in the classroom with on-site coaching
  • Provides a full year of daily lesson plans and classroom material
  • Leverages technology by providing a custom-designed digital platform for teachers to analyze their student data and strategize with Reading In Motion coaches
  • Evaluation is based on DIBELS - Dynamic Indicators of Basic Early Literacy Skills and strategy is based on test results from the beginning, middle and end of the academic year
  • Additional support for teachers is provided based on need through Reading In Motion Extra Dosage Instructors
For more information, contact Anne Smith, Director of Development: asmith@readinginmotion.org

story:
Our History

The Uganda society is one of the oldest institutions in Uganda founded in 1923. The society also manages The Uganda Society Library which happens to be the oldest Library in the country.The Uganda Society has played an important role in preserving Uganda's cultural diversity and scientific heritage.

Why "give me those books  campaign?"

Very  many people have asked us what we are doing to get  books that are lying in different offices,homes and corridors with out any body bothering to take care and preserve them.We had the idea but did not have resources to implement it.Another reason that has been itching us here is the difficulties one go through  to get a 50 year old news paper  or a 100 year old book in the country.The response one gets asking about the old archives is that they were burnt by fire,destroyed by termites,old things are not useful therefore they were thrown away .We want to change this norm so that in future people can get this information with ease.

By contributing to  "give me those books campaign" you will be helping in the preservation of documentary heritage in Uganda for future generations.You will also be promoting public awareness on the use of preserving and protecting books in the country.

The project.

We plan to collect one  hundred thousand  (100,000) books in a period of three months starting with June ,July and August 2016.The campaign is targeting various books including biographies ,natural history books ,historical collections,Novels, unpublished manuscripts ,old maps,rare books , anthropology collections ,ethnography,accounts ,Journals , old newspapers and correspondences between different administrators all about Uganda and Africa in general.The books or documents to be collected in this campaign include those published before 1860 and those that have been published after 1860 to 2005 .

In order for this project to succeed ,we need your contribution.

We have budgeted for $7500 to make sure that our team of 8 volunteers are everywhere in the 4 regions of the country ie; Eastern region,Central region,Northern region and the Western region.

30% will be spent on buying some of the rare books about Uganda from international book stores.

20% of the contributed funds will be spent on facilitating the volunteers by establishing collecting spots in all areas in the country,accommodation,transport and up keep in form of meals.

20% of the funds will be spent on printing T-shirts ,brochures ,Capes,  bags  and certificates of recognition for all those that would be willing to give out their books and a prize for to the person that will contribute most valuable books in this campaign.

In addition to this,plastic boxes will also be bought to help in the packing of the books.

25% of the funds will be spent transportation of the collected books to The Uganda Society Library located at Uganda Museum.

5% of the funds raised will be used to pay the Indiegogo platform fee.

Once at Uganda Museum,the books would be digitized by The Uganda Society Library.We will keep the books in the Uganda Society Library , The Uganda Museum resource center and the National Library.We are aware of the copy right issues in the world.Only the books which have copyright permission and those whose copy right has expired would be digitized and uploaded into our internet archive.The  The Uganda society Library management would help to negotiate copy right permissions with the publishers or writers. .But the most important objective of this campaign is to collect the books and have them conserved and preserved in a proper environment that the books deserve and be accessible to the public.

The Impact

Your contribution to this cause is vital to the preservation of books (documentary heritage )and will help change the mindset of people on what they think about books.Books are not toilet papers or tissues for use in Latrines or packaging materials for use in shops,they are source of Knowledge and information.

Risks & Challenges

We are aware that the reading culture is still a big problem .Book preservation campaigns like this do not sound good to some people's ears like it would have been if somebody talked about the beer festival but we continue to reach out to people through our reading forums , book exhibitions and public talks.
Library and information science profession continue to lag behind in the country and people think that the only work a librarian has got to do is to sit and wait for the researchers to come and browse through the books as he assists them.This notion has killed creativity in Libraries in the country and hence people's description of libraries as a "place where books go to die".We want to change this notion to instead a" place where books go to live"

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also become a member of The Uganda Society .Visit The Uganda Society Library for more information or send an email to the contacts below.
You can also help share this campaign with in your networks to make it happen.If you also have the books to give out ,you can give them to us.
